Reviews.Title: “great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael g
Reviews.Content: Very central and only 500m to St Mark's Square. Stayed end of March so got a great deal on hotel and excellent dry weather. Only criticism would be the restaurant for breakfast is tight and very warm and humid. Take advantage of the free water taxi out to Murano - don't buy in factory as cheaper outside - then get water bus back 7 euros.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB HOTEL IN EXCELLENT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: tofty75
Reviews.Content: I arrived back today from a 3 nights stay at the Kette Hotel, Venice. I couldn't wait to put my review on here! I've read some negative reviews about it and was a little wary as for some silly reason I believe the negative above the positive and all I can say is IGNORE THE SILLY NEGATIVE REVIEWS! Myself and partner flew with Jet 2 holidays and they were superb, easy check in with efficient friendly staff and the same with the cabin crew. Upon arriving in Venice we opted for the water bus, NOT WATER TAXI! It will cost you 25e for a return trip, better than 100e for a one way ride on a water taxi! The only down side is the water bus does take over an hour. Upon arriving at San Marco water stop you turned left, walked over a bridge and the hotel is there, literally less than 5 mins walk. The location is amazing. Check in was quick and friendly greetings by staff. We were told we had been given a free upgrade to a canal view (room 134) the room was spotless, lovely comfortable bed and canal view and a very modern bathroom with good shower. Keeping with the hotel, we were bed & breakfast. I'm not one for continental breakfast and suppose I'm a typical Brit with bacon and egg! I've got to say that I've never had such wonderful breakfasts. Plenty of cold meats to choose from, cheese, cereal, boiled eggs and croissants. (I've never had croissants so tasty!) the coffee was also excellent and plenty of it. I've no idea why people moaned about the breakfast here. I can agree that the dining room is small and if u go for breakfast anytime after 9am, u may have to wait a very short time for a table and it does get crowded around the serving/seating area, but it's certainly nothing to moan about! The staff are very efficient and keep you topped up with coffee and juices. Some people have moaned about 'a heavy key fob!' yes it is heavy but why the hell are you carrying it around with you??? Leave it at reception when you go out and collect it when u return like we did! Your room is safe and noones going to go in, if your worried then use the room safe! The staff were friendly, not over friendly but would more say polite. The only issue I had was that a lot of Italians were extremely rude when out and about and would simply shove you out of the way to get past, along with a lot of very rude French people we encountered! The location of this hotel is superb and I would definitely go back to Venice and wouldn't hesitate staying at the Kette Hotel again. It's superb location and value for money made it an amazing trip! In relation to Venice itself, I loved it. Yeah it will cost you Â£28 for 2 coffees in St Marks square but u expect that, also, when u sit at a table in the square, you will be charged 5.70e each for when the orchestra plays!!! This is before you even place your order! Venice I expensive but not as bad as I expected. All in all, a superb 4 day break and loved every minute of it. Enjoy your stay and feel free to message me if u want any tips or advice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Ramjam
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend here with my mum and my husband in March 2012 and we loved the hotel! All the staff were helpful, professional and attentive, they spoke good English (sadly our Italian wasn't up to much!). The foyer looked very grand and the rooms were lovely, clean and decorated in a lovely venetian style with grand light fittings and lovely mirrors and pictures. We requested a canal view and it was lovely to open the windows every morning to see boats going past (and hear the gondeliers singing!) The location was fab. 3 mins away from the Vaporetti stop, next to St Mark's Square and in the heart of San Marco. Don't expect a big fancy breakfast though! I'm not a big breakfast eater so I was happy with a bowl of cereal and a piece of fruit however my Mum and Husband were slightly disappointed with the choice and quality of the continental breakfast. There was lots there, eggs, meat, cheese, pastries, fruit, jams, yogurts, cereal etc but a few things including the coffee didn't taste very nice! As it was included in the cost of the hotel though you can't really complain and they definitely didn't go hungry! The breakfast room is also tiny considering the size of the hotel so it's generally best to get down to breakfast by 8am. We turned up at 9.15 on the last day and had to wait in a 5-10 minute queue. The staff were working flat out to get everyone in and out quickly though and the service was excellent. You can purchase wifi at the hotel which worked well and there is a PC with printer that you can use for printing boarding passes if you pay 2 euros to use it for 30 mins. Overall we were extremely happy with our choice of hotel and would recommend Kette to anyone looking for an elegant hotel with good location and helpful staff at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Never seen a hotel that loves itself so much.”
Reviews.Author: Cutebugtravels12345
Reviews.Content: The kette was a lovely Venice hotel. Very pricey!!! But isn't everything in Venice?? I found the fact that you pay over $300 a night but aren't offered decent maps or complementary water taxi to the train station SHOCKING. They expect you to pay over $100 for one way to the station. Seriously. (note you can hop on a water bus for about $6 a person at a close by square- but they won't tell you that) I did find it to be a very nice hotel overall. Don't rely on staff to help you find your way around or openly chit chat or anything. The map provided is worse than having no map at all. (but Venice is a maze itself so you will get lost no matter what) Don't get me wrong- I liked it. But the only way to really describe it is "uppity" or "snotty". Lovely bathrooms - large and almost American (which is very hard to come by in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: Ani22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nites at Kette and our experience wasnt good. The room was small , had a stink and was suffocating. We preferred being out and unless we needed to go back to sleep we wouldnt. The hotel is located close to San Marco but thats the only good thing i guess. I wouldnt recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, location great.”
Reviews.Author: debbiek37
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Kette Hotel for 6 nights in November. The staff were reasonably friendly but quite stand-offish at times. A downside was the alleged cocktail bar, which actually only served beer- the usual barman was off sick so service was very limited. The room was a decent size, but unfortunately overlooked a large scaffolded area (this was an upgraded room)- we asked to change rooms but were told the hotel was full, despite us never never actually seeing another guest. The room had very little in the way of natural light and tended to be pitch dark even during the day. However, location was very convenient, a sohrt walk to all the major sites. Having said that, if I went back to Venice I would definitely pick a different hotel, there is so much competition and I just don't feel the Hotel Kette can compete.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: fatfin
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Kette Hotel in October 2011. We had a lovely room, which overlooked a small canal. The breakfast was enough for us, (the tea and coffee was ok) although sometime with a bigger appetite might want a bit more!! The location is excellent for exploring Venice. To find the hotel, there are two alleyways, the first one is a little difficult to spot as there was scaffolding up so you may miss the entrance. ATMs are nearby. Would recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MeganM76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I as well as the group of friends we were travelling with stayed at the Kette hotel for two nights. Tucked behind the La Fenice Opera House it was in a good location very near to St. Marks and many other points of interest in Venice. If you book through Easy Jet be sure to bring a printout of your reservation (aka your voucher). We were treated rather harshly for not having the voucher, told that they could not prove we were who we said we were without it (despite providing out passports and a confirmation number) so just be forewarned. There are probably instructions somewhere to this effect, but nobody in our group managed to glean this information beforehand and the man at the front desk was less than pleased. We were on the fifth floor and our room was nice, but nothing extraordinary. The dÃ©cor was a bit dated but everything was clean and comfortable. We booked the room and breakfast each morning which was well worth it. Lots of choices and everything was delicious. The downstairs has a few â€˜living areasâ€™ that are nice and comfortable and a good meeting place for our party every morning. All in all the hotel was fine for a few days in Venice, nothing to write home about but I wish the staff would have been a little friendlier about the voucher situation (albeit a possible oversight on our part).

Reviews.Title: “September 2011 Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Beth F
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a 16 day tour of Italy and Greece. The front desk staff were very kind and helpful. These men helped us learn several words in Italian and showed us the language is more of an attitude than a spoken word! They werer great. The other staff were excellent. The breakfast that was served every morning was the best. The coffee was outrstanding. Located in walking distance to everything. Take your electirical converters. We were very pleased with theroom and the whole experience. Wouls go back to Venics and stay at the Kette again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: dnsmcklr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were very happy with our stay. The room was typical by European standards but the bathroom was a very pleasant surprise - extremely large. The hair dryer was a bit old and could use updating but other than that it was perfect. The hotel is very centrally located. The front desk staff was excellent. They recommended 2 wonderful restaurants and even took the initiative of calling the restaurant without our knowledge to tell them we might be coming. When we arrived they were full, but when they were told that our hotel had recommended them, they told us we had one of the reserved tables since they had called! Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, elegant room - large marble bath and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence I
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay! I can still hear "O sole mio" ringing in from the musicians playing in the square beneath our room - very romantic. Yes, the rooms have closed shutters but, they open - typical of Venetian buildings - part of the charm. A very convenient location, nice breakfast and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a Dungeon”
Reviews.Author: pamlSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this Hotel in September before we boarded a Mediterranean Cruise. The speedboat trip to the canal was fabulous but we were sadly very disappointed when we checked into the Junior Suite in our hotel...The room smelt musty and all lights had to be on at all times as all windows had closed shutters which did not open and I can only describe the room as a dark dungeon. We did not complain as it was only the one night and we made sure we were out and about as much as possible. I have stayed in other hotels in Venice and have always enjoyed the experience....sadly, we would never book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “hard to find due to construction”
Reviews.Author: jackiekos
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent suggested the Kette for its' proximity to San Marco Square. Spent 2 nights Oct. 6 & 7 before our cruise. Hotel was adequate for our needs but a little too expensive. The room was small and did NOT have a view of the canal as we would have liked. Bathroom is nice and modern. Breakfast was good but I agree with other reviews that the breakfast room is too small. Very good coffee. Got a map from the front desk which was very helpful getting around. Took a water taxi from the back door of the Kette to the ship which cost 90E, pricey but at least we didn't have to walk the streets with all our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit pricey though.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Jan_Oregon
Reviews.Content: We took a private taxi (70E) to the Hotel Kette, but the taxi could not drop us at the private Kette canal entrance because of the tides. So, we had to walk about a block to find the hotel, which was behind another building under construction (look for Moise signs to help). The staff is very helpful and they speak several languages (I heard French, English and Italian). We skipped the 20E per person breakfast and took a walk to find some less expensive cappuccino and croissants. The breakfast room (aka the bar) is very small and cramped. I don't know why they don't switch the computer/reading room with the breakfast room...it would make a big difference. The WiFi was 5E for 2 hours and I had to stand in hallway near my room to use it (but at least it worked!). The rooms are small, but comfortable and the bathroom was the nicest of our 2 week trip. If you are going to be there for more than 2 days, I would definitely buy a multi-day vaporetto (bus) pass...it's easy to get from place to place using the water bus system. If you have an early morning flight, it could be very expensive to leave the island (plus the water bus system does not run 24x7)! Private water taxis from the island can be super expensive and then you will need another shuttle when you get over by the airport. We moved over to Mestre (on the mainland) for our last night and it was easy to take a pre-reserved taxi to the Marco Polo Airport (35E) that was only 15 minutes away. We took the train to Mestre from the main Venice train terminal because ALL trains stop in Mestre! We paid 2.40E for two people to take the 7 minute train ride to Mestre (which is a lovely little town) and stayed at the Best Western Bologna right next to the train station. Don't forget to save some Euros to check out of the Hotel Kette (even if you prepaid your hotel room). There is a new city tax that must be paid IN CASH before you leave, which I believe was 4E per person per night.

Reviews.Title: “Young travelers - do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sarahmorrison
Reviews.Content: My two and I were traveling Europe and our agent booked us a room here because of price and location. We met another friend in Venice for the day to tour the city together as she was also traveling through Italy. That particular day the Italian transit went on strike around noon so my friend who met us for the day had no way of leaving the island until the next day at noon when the strike was off. We assumed she would have no problem staying with us in our hotel that night. We came back to Hotel Kette around 11pm and the manager at the front desk had the front door locked. He asked to see all of our ID's which we had but because my one friend did not have a reservation he would not let her in. We tried to explain the situation to him (WAHGHI EL DIN) but he was incredibly ignorant and threatened to not let any of us back in the hotel. We pleaded with him and he ended up charging my friend 200 euros to purchase her own room instead of letting her stay with us. The next morning we were walking down to breakfast and overheard this man (WAGHI EL DIN) mocking us in Italian to his co workers. We were extremely upset and the entire ordeal ruined our trip in Venice. YOUNG TRAVELERS do not stay here. Ignorant, rude, and unaccommodating!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: spikey2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to St Marks Square, very centrally located in Venice. We find it well prices, and reasonable comfortable - being in an old building in Venice. Power sockets are the old Italian type, not the modern ones, so plugs with the thick prongs don't fit. Breakfast is tasty, but the breakfast room can get very crowded. We have been staying several times there and have no reservations to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not the best on our trip”
Reviews.Author: Mash1811
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and the hotel was very charming with a view of the canal. I didn't care for the breakfast room. It was too small and crowded to even move around in. The bar in the evenings was great though and the bar tender was vey nice. The room was kinda small, but the shower was great with good water pressure. Location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepeplaq
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in early August bbefore boarding ship for cruise. Hotel was in a quite area but still very close to San Marcos Square. The breakfast was very good and the coffee was great. A little on the expensive side but then again there is not much that is cheap in Venice. Would defenitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, busy location”
Reviews.Author: send2ram
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in our 2 nights @ Venice recently. First of all it was a bit of a challenge for us to drag our medium sized suitcases (14 days in Italy hence..) over the luggage unfriendly bridges near San Marco, when we managed to get to the street there was no sign for San Moise street since there is a construction going on in the building on front of the hotel. Remember take the lane opposite GUCCI showroom near San Marco Square. Or look for signs for Hotel San Moise rather than Kette. Entry : well decorated like many of the hotels in Venice. Rooms : Bit tight, walls are decorated in Antique fashion. Good bathroom. Funnily had to take the elevator to 4th floor to get to our room on 3rd (a kind of Harry potter like 3.5th floor) perhaps the portion of building with our rooms has sunk a bit. Hotel Staff: Was very courteous. Overall a good experience, but would have expected a bit more for the high price you pay for overrated location near San Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “A nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnMac1947
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel Kette around 01:00 (a lazy 7 hours late thanks to our train from Paris breaking down at Modane) which was a bit stressful for a couple of "first time in Italy" Australians who suddenly found themselves not knowing where we needed to go and not having a taxi driver to assist however the night manager gave us good information on the phone and then smoothly checked us in and made us feel at home when we arrived. The rooms were clean and (once I worked out the external shutters) light and airy. Our room had only a limited view of the canals but that didn't detract from our experience. All the staff were helpful during our stay and the location in San Marco is first rate. San Marco does seem to be the pick of the districts to stay in (based on walking pretty much over all the island on both sides of the grand canal) and hotel Kette is ideally placed. I had read a few negative reviews before we arrived and was a little apprehensive but nothing in our experience matched the negative reviews. In common with most hotels in France and Italy at we stayed at, the lifts are very small and the rooms lack a separate shower but these are minor complaints. We would certainly stay there again on any future return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ourdream2
Reviews.Content: Clean and great location. Walking distance from S. Marco and many other main services and facilities such as water bus stops, Gondolas and restaurants. The breakfast is good but in small hall. Two lifts available. Nice minor canal view and we had many pics and videos for the Gondolas with serenade passing through this canal. There is a tasty seafood restaurant behind the Hotel (Vino). We came through Water Taxi which took us directly to the Hotel's secondary door. The Receptionist in that time was great gentleman. Many thanks to Mr. M. Wajeh too, he suggested two great restaurants to us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidayaddict00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very quiet and the service is excellent. The rooms are clean and the public areas are smart. The breakfast is simple but good.

Reviews.Title: “Counted the minutes until we checked out”
Reviews.Author: Week38
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Kette was arranged by a travel agent whose winning streak with accomodations ended here. When we arrived via water taxi, we strolled a short 5 minute walk to the hotel. One of our first impressions of the property was the monstrosity under construction across from the hotel. It's unappealing, blocks light and the work being done to the place generates a great deal of noise throughout the day. Still, once in the Kette, all seemed well in the lobby. It was clearly older but attractive to the eye and the hotel staff was very nice. However, once each couple entered their rooms, you could hear collective shrieks of disgust. One room, a non-superior, was dingy. The carpeting, furniture, linens, etc. all looked tired. The room had a lovely view of a concrete wall. The shower was the size of a coffin. The second room smelled like cigarettes and the carpet looked as if it was stained with the outline of a body. The wi-fi wasnt working though if it were, we would have had to pay to use it. The rooms were so unappealing that we were more than motivated to spend time outside of the hotel. We also hated the location which was too close to the overwhelming crush of tourists who spill into San Marco. We would've preferred one of Venice's more low key, civilized neighborhoods. Though we hated the accomodations, we loved the staff. The gentleman attending to guests in the lounge was particulalry nice. Everyone was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and room let this Hotel down”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie186466
Reviews.Content: Room was very small with a view of roof tops and nothing else. Breakfast was in a small room and over crowded at the time we went once you sat down it was difficult to get up without making others move for you, not a lot on offer for the quality of Hotel and the staff at breakfast were not the most helpful. The reception staff and porter were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieJess12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after it was recommended to us by friends and it didnâ€™t disappoint. We had a â€˜Superior Roomâ€™ which was lovely. We had asked for a room that overlooked the canals and thatâ€™s what we got â€“ right on the corner so we could see all the way down the canal and could hear and watch the guys singing on the gondolas! The room was lovely, with a comfortable bed (pillows not so great) and a huge bathroom. Unfortunately the only power points were being used by the TV and the fridge so we had to unplug the TV when we had to charge things. The hotel staff were happy to help and provided us with some great dining options. Breakfast was OK but nothing too flash for those of us used to â€˜big breakfastsâ€™. From memory we had to pay 10 euro a day for WiFi which is annoying. The hotel is in a perfect location (though can be hard to find â€“ like everything else in Venice!), easy walk to the big attractions. Would definitely recommend, just make sure you ask to be on the canal side.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ank K
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 415 and 416. Horrible Horrible rooms. The AC in 415 wasn't cooling the room. Mentioned it to guy at the front desk within an hour of checking in and his response "all the rooms are like this. There's nothing we can do". Then, asked the front desk as to the best & cheapest way to get the airport and his response was to get 120 euro private taxi from the hotel instead of mentioning the ALILAGUNA watertaxi service that runs from the St Mark's Piazza which is about 5 mins walk from the hotel. Location is great and the hotel is accessible. Aside from that, I wouldn't spend an hour at this place.

Reviews.Title: “More than expectaed”
Reviews.Author: EscarpmOntario
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Kette for 3 nights first week of August. At the beginning we were given room overlooking construction, but once requested a change, were given room overlooking the canal. What a joy to keep windows open and get up with the gondoliers' songs: "chao, chao bambino". People that criticize breakfast, probably not aware that European breakfast is traditionally just coffee and croissant. This one had offered an exceptionally great choice of food and fantastic coffee. Staff is friendly (again by European standards). We, in Canada are killing ourselves to please customers, and we are surprised people in Europe don't. We have to remember that tourists will come there forever and ever, and who would come to London, Ontario? At last, I would recommend to spend some extra and get superior room. This might be a deal breaker how one perceive this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at this Hotel and we will return”
Reviews.Author: Daffy043
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this Hotel with my Husband, Mother and Brother. We booked the Hotel for our second trip to Venice as the locaiton is great, yes there is building work going on opposite the Hotel, but it is in the day when you are not usually in your room so not a problem. The rooms are looking a little tired, but the reception areas, staff and location make up for it. I note the comment earlier about the charge for using the safe in your room and just wanted to let everyone know there is no charge, you just have to use your credit card or a debit card to open the safe, it reads the strip and then wan't open for anyone else, there is no charge whatsevever. We had a meal at Vino Vino just behind the Hotel which was lovely and also at there sister restaurant Antica Martini by the Theatre which was excellent, although rather expensive. Book your visit to the Basilica and Palazzo Ducale on the internet before your departure and you will not have to queue in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve a four star rating”
Reviews.Author: KimmieH-11
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this hotel. The beds in the rooms are extremely old and following our second night had to ask for extra boards (as they didn't have a spare mattress) to put underneath the mattress to stop the bed from sinking. Very squeaky springs! Also the rooms were very warm as the air conditioning doesn't work and if you open the windows you end up with a room full of mozzies. Had to pay for wi fi which we found quite surprising as we have not had to pay anywhere else on our European holiday. Also had to pay if we wanted to use the safe in our room. There is no power point in the rooms if you wish to charge phones, laptops or use hairdryers using a converter. Breakfast was very average, no fresh fruit available and disappointing in every aspect. We are surprised that this hotel has been given a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dianawo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, central to the posh shops and canals, less than five minutes walk from St Mark's Square, the breakfast room was small but plenty of choice. The room was fantastic, no bath though!! Reception staff were friendly and knowledgeable, they really really assited us as it was our first trip to Venice, we will return. Take an umbrella and waterproof clothing in February/March.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Rockman0178
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and nicely decorated although quite small, but this is Venice and you don't go there to sit in your hotel room! The size of the room was more than offset by the enormous balcony (about 30 feet X 25 feet) that went with it - so ask for room 501. We sat out there most nights before going to bed and didn't get eaten by any bugs and these were hot July nights. The hotel itself is a typical old Venetian hotel with lovely decor. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful, especially the guy on night duty in reception. The hotel is very quiet and is nicely situated for doing all the touristy bits in and around Venice. Would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a magnificent city!”
Reviews.Author: PalmiraE
Reviews.Content: I am not used to writing reviews,but I really wnated to write this one...I 've stayed in the Kette Hotel twice and both times I was very pleased...The staff was very polite and the rooms were clean(which is extremely important to me..) and quite large...Also,the location is great,right in the center,close to Saint Mark's square but away from the noise and the crowd..!!The breakfast was quite rich and tasty(especially the croissants..:-) ) and the employees were very polite and helpful!!On the downside,the breakfast room was a bit small and the tables were a bit crowded,although,somehow,it didn't bother us as much as one would think.. I strongly recommend that hotel for a nice,not overprized but still satisfaying stay in the unique city of Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: bboop907
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. Hotel has a great location but the staff is not helpful or friendly. Pillows & beds are hard as rocks, no washcloths or bath amenities other than soap & shower cap, hair dryers must be 25 years old & are adequate at best, internet is not free. When we asked staff if they would print our boarding passes they said we had to buy their internet card. The only one somewhat helpful was the bartender, Jon Luca. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice location, but looking a little outdated.”
Reviews.Author: bluwaterz
Reviews.Content: Great location very close to San Marco Square. The decor is looking tired but our room overlooked a small canal which was fun to look out over boat traffic. Nice enough though.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting so much more, not 4 star at all !!”
Reviews.Author: auntyeese
Reviews.Content: After a 10 day cruise we decided to spend an extra 2 days with our friends in Venice at the Kette. Just to let you know building work has just started in front of the Hotel and is likely to go on for over a year according to the information posted about the renovations. We asked could we have a quiet room, as we did not want to listen to the building noise, and the hotel kindly obliged us. We were shown to a room at the back overlooking the canal, Room 302, however this was very drab and small, so we asked for another room , and we were moved to 212, the same dull decor but the room was a lot bigger. Our room now faced the building work. No problem we would just keep the windows closed and put the air conditioning on . Wrong !! air conditioning is not allowed in the Hotel till June . To have the air conditioning on any earlier than that, is apparently at the management's discretion. I am recovering from Cancer and struggling with some health issues, and I found the stifling room absolutely unbearable. I was really upset at the situation and spoke to reception but there was nothing they could do, this is supposed to be a 4 star Hotel and they can't even afford to run the air conditioning . Perhaps the hotel could take notice and have some electric fans available for guests who need a cooler room during the non air conditioning season.. Breakfast is nothing special very basic ,meats, cereal, tinned fruit and some cakes etc. The public areas are nice. The bar is open till 11.30 pm if you are lucky. We wanted a nightcap in the bar at 11.15 pm and were made to feel as though we were a nuisance for ordering drinks so late. The staff are a strange mix, some very friendly and helpful others not. This is the first Hotel I have ever been truly disappointed with and I would not reccomend it on that basis. I know Venice is very expensive but this Hotel does not represent good value for money. Customer service does not come first. The photographs on the website are not a true reflection of the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-small beds&pillows-GREAT breakfast-Outstanding location!”
Reviews.Author: hrhjwb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kette is extremely easy to get to from the pier at San Marco via boat bus from airport. The cost of the hotel was expensive for what you get room wise, but less than others the hotel is more 3-star than 4. The staff was helpful with directions. The best place to eat is a small walk its call al Covo it was PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: ForeverYoung50
Reviews.Content: Our room was brilliant! It was very spacious, well-appointed and charming (even a chandelier over the bed!). We were on the 4th floor at the rear and our two shuttered windows overlooked a canal and a little bridge which was a treat to watch the gondolas and other watercraft make their way up and down. The room was divided into bedroom and living and the bathroom was off a short hallway with the wardrobe at the end. The room was beautifully decorated and very quiet. My only criticism was with the bathroom. The shower struggled to supply enough hot water for two people to shower consecutively. The shower was over the bath, but didn't have sufficient screening to prevent water flooding the floor. The "worm" hairdryer was pitiful. It got so hot to hold that I had to wrap a towel around it to use but the air blowing out of it was barely warm so therefore it didn't do a great job. The reception areas, the bar and sitting rooms of the Kette were all lovely. The breakfast room though small, still managed and provided a great breakfast with plenty of variety and good quality. It also gave guests the opportunity to mingle with each other. The service was fantastic at the Kette Hotel! They even offered a free water-taxi for transporting guests to Murano Island to see the glass making (you have to arrange your own transport back to Venice though). The location of the Kette is great. It's close to Piazza San Marco and it's not that far from the Rialto Bridge. There's a great little restaurant behind the Kette over the little bridge called "VinoVino". It offers reasonable food at reasonable prices and the service is great! Venice can be expensive for eating if you don't look around .. as our tour guide said about one restaurant in Piazza San Marco, "they even charge for the air you breathe!" Actually, the two hour walking tour is highly recommended! One thing I wouldn't recommend, is the pre-booked "Gondola Serenade Tour" that starts from Campo Santa Maria del Giglio. It cost $142 and was disappointing. No romantic ride here (not sharing a gondola with 3 others and not sitting next to your partner) and having a gondolier who chain-smoked and wouldn't wear his hat despite repeatedly being asked to. Travelling in a fleet of 4 gondolas huddled together with a singer and accordianist in one of the four), it was not what you'd expect a romantic gondola serenade to be. I would still take a gondola ride but just like with restaurants, look around for a better deal (80 euros seemed to be the going rate) and seek out a nicer gondolier. Overall, Venice is beautiful so let yourself get lost in the alleys and streets, admire it's beauty and just enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly services”
Reviews.Author: Scheuermann
Reviews.Content: We didn't like our stay in this hotel for the following reasons: - the waiter in the breakfeast room was quite unfriendly and didn't want to serve me a coffee after he understood that we want to have tea altogether. He was refusing to serve any "additional" drink - breakfeast room is much 2 small and guests had troubles with finding places. Also quite inconvenient place since everybody is sitting very close to each other. The rest is ok, but it is not that what we expected from a 4 star hotel. The rooms are clean, but you can see that they were quite used. The only really posive aspect to mention is the location which is not far away from the St. Marcus Squarre. All in all we think that this hotel is too expensive for the services offered....

Reviews.Title: “Venice in two days”
Reviews.Author: curtinj
Reviews.Content: I must say, the Hotel Kette proved to be a real gem of a hotel. It is located on San Marco a short walk to St. Mark's Square. We found the staff to be extraordinary and knowledgeable. The rooms were well appointed and very comfortable; offering a good nights rest after walking the City during the day. While we did not eat at the hotel for their breakfast offerings, we found a nearby sidewalk stand up cafe that offered just what you needed to start your day; yes; wonderful Italian coffee, freshly squeezed orange juice, baked goods. The locals frequented the place, so that tells you as well that it wasn't overpriced. Unfortunately, I don't recall the name of the place as we just happened upon it while exploring one morning. While our stay was short, we recommend taking a walking tour as well as a boat tour of the islands. You will find both well worth your while. The City is very walkable, easy to get yourself lost and easy to find your way again. Enjoy the trip; but do yourself a favor, and buy a pair of plastic pull over boots at the hotel, when the tide comes in, the City water does rise quite high in some spots; not worth destroying a pair of shoes; spring for the boots. The food and wine offerings are first rate; be sure to make a dinner reservation if you want to guarantee yourself a seating at a reasonable hour. Enjoy this wonderful oasis. James & Cheryl Curtin

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Darlings!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbieb042
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Staff were friendly and helpful no matter what time of day or night. the breakfast had enough choice .The location is good and near to good restaurants,shopping and main attractions. You can get the water bus from airport to san marco and the walk to hotel is approx 10mins but you will need a map. you can get a water taxi to the hotel cost approx 100 euros. The rooms are clean although only 1 plug for those essential hair straightners so no TV whilst straightning hair!! I would use this hotel again ..I had my Mum with me and trust me if she was impressed by the staff they were definatley doing it right !! Well Done all at Hotel Kette xx

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtraveler123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in february. First of all, I don't expect to be staying in a brand new place in pristine condition. We are, after all, in Venice. However, as soon as I entered the room and looked around I was already disappointed. It was stuffy, the wallpaper and curtains looked dingy. Wallpaper was peeling off the sides, and worst of all was the overwhelming smell of mothballs...ugh. The carpet looked so old and dirty I was afraid to take my shoes off. The bed was not comfortable at all and the hotel itself was very noisy. Maybe we were staying next to a storage closet or something but at 5am, there was all this commotion outside the door. Later, there were trashbags and vacuum cleaners just sitting in the hallway...we had to pay for wifi...like I said...NOT 4 star quality. I would NEVER come back here. If we hadnt already prepaid, I would have checked out early.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in great location”
Reviews.Author: jlc92
Reviews.Content: For the location, this hotel is a good value. It's an old-fashioned place that doesn't have many modern amenities, but it's comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is nothing special, and the internet was not free. We were able to walk everywhere from here, but didn't want to spend much time in our room as it was rather small and plain.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ColleenMarge
Reviews.Content: Rooms warm, clean, small. If you are taller than 5'8" the shower is a struggle as it cannot be adjusted. Breakfast ordinary and although the coffee is plentiful it is awful!! Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “super decor and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: JohnCHPerry
Reviews.Content: Quiet, calm and close to San Marco. Our room was lovely and very warm and we had a canal view. Breakfast is ok and sufficient if you are used to a big meal. Front desk was very helpful for directions and arranging water taxi etc etc Treat yourself and arrive and leave by water taxi. Would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to get Venice to yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Flashback1966
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice in May 2010. I was not sure what to expect from Venice, but I really loved it. Weather was great. We chose Hotel Kette, as it was in Venice city itself, rather then say in Mestre (which is on the Italian mainland and no doubt cheaper option). If you stay in Mestre, you have to commute in to Venice everyday (which at my guess would take 2hours to get in). Since, it takes 45mins by boat to get to San Marco from the train or bus station. For us to stay in Venice city, was the right decision, because I could get to San Marco in 5mins and a great way to avoid the crowds in the morning (before 10am) when most tourist have not arrived and evenings (after 8pm) when most tourists have to take the boat back to the mainland. The water buses stop by 11pm, so it even gets quieter then. You can walk from the bus or railway station to San Marco, but that is about 2 to 3hours walk. So water bus is a good idea. If you decide against staying at Hotel Kette, avoid the hotels near the train station, as the is a lot more populated with fumes from the bus station, busy and hectic. ARRIVING FROM AIRPORT (Venice Marco Polo): best way to get to Hotel Kette and in style, is via the Water bus from the airport (costs about 15 Euros). You can take a Water taxi (100 Euros), but it is a lot less fun, as they are going by speed boat, but the water bus is more relaxed and a nice way to approach Venice. (See hotel web site for instructions). When you arrive at San Marco, you will need to wheel your luggage to the Hotel and along the way there are bridge/steps, so not appropriate for elderly. However, there are men with hand trolleys and they can carry the luggage for your to the hotel. Not sure the price. But I recommend it if it cheap enough. It will save the wheels on your luggage. Although, it is only 5mins, it took us nearly 20mins, as I had to look at the map. The guide onm Hotel Kette's web site is very good, except we missed the 'alley' for the hotel. After you take the steps up and down the bridge, look out for the persian carpet store, next to is the passeway you need to take (look out for the blue mosaic tiles on the ground pointing to Martinez night club). HOTEL: The Hotel is over several floors, but it is a smaller hotel. The Rooms are nice and clean. We got a nice breeze when we opened the window. Our room had a narrow glimpse of the canal. Wi-fi is extra. A bit annoyed that there is a daily safe hire charge extra, which is annoying as my travel insurance is invalid, unless valuable are kept in the safe!. The room had double glazed windows and shutters too. BREAKFAST: The breakfast was good. The breakfast room is small. GONDOLA RIDES: These cost 80 Euros for 40mins and at nighttime even more!. It costs more to go on the grand canal, but I think the water is more choppy there, so I prefer the small lanes. FOOD: Food in Venice is disappointing. They are never going to see you again, so there is no incentive to impress. However, food at Zucca is good (vegetarian), but a little out of the way. Also, Rialto market is an excellent place to pick up ready made fruit salad. In Italy, starters plates are the size as mains. Lots of restaurants offer tourist menus consisting of Spagetti and Pizza. It may have been invented in Italy, but Pizza Pasta is available all over the world. I ended up eating at Chinese restaurants, which was not a bad decision, as the Chinese has a slight Italian influence. I found one near San Marco and also another near the train station. (I always try to eat local foods, but not in Venice). You can get Pizza slices for 2.50 Euros. Water bottles at 2Euros. Main meals can be around 20 Euros per person. Toilets are tricky to find, so yoru best bet is to go to a bar, pay 1 Euro for an expresso and use the toilet for the entire family. Much cheaper then paying 1 Euro for a public toilet. HOW LONG TO STAY: We stayed 4 nights, but I think this was not enough. As the first and last day are wasted on checking in and checking out. There are a couple of neighbouring islands to explore. SIGHTSEEING: We ended up walking quite a lot in Venice. Almost 8-9 hours per day. So get comfortable shoes is a must. It is the only way, I suppose. You could take the water bus, but they only go up and down the grand canal. You have to plan your day well. I found the Insight Guide contain the best maps / guides.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location BUT....”
Reviews.Author: atm2010
Reviews.Content: Quiet street only a few hundred yards from St. Mark's .Perfect base for exploring the city. Great bathroom, heavy bathrobes, good towels etc. Rooms to the front currently have a view of a building site but side rooms have view of small canal .Very quiet at night. 'disabled-access' friendly.Breakfast is OK; good coffee and lots of it. Terrible tinned fruit..I haven't seen that kind of 'fruit cocktail' since the early 70s ..It's worth reading a bit about what '4 stars' actually means in Italy. BUT , at this time of year...and in spring, I suppose...the hotel is one of the many properties in the San Marco area that is impossible to get into or out of , twice a day and for several hours, without...wellies! I don't mean that there's a bit of water and your shoes will get damp.I mean that the smaller, access, roads to the hotel will be under water and you will have to paddle. You will be able to buy ' disposable' boots at Reception...8Euros a pair. We're glad we decided to take our own boots with us..for their relative 'comfort'. On the 'flooding' question...Since you're going to have to accommodate some level of it anyway, enjoy the ' acqua alta' :)Paddling through the Square and surrounding streets instead of using the temporary walkways is fun and hearing the WW2 sirens indicate the expected level of flooding is quite an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Beautiful, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: RBandNB
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed with the accommodations here. The rooms are spacious, spotlessly clean and well appointed. The bathrooms are large and our room had a sitting room on the 4th floor that overlooked a canal leading to homes and businesses. Nothing in Venice is inexpensive by a long stretch, but this hotel was within easy walking distance to interesting parts of Venice and easy to find. That is what we wanted. We found the staff to be aloof and busy, but we were self-sufficient with public transit and how to spend our time. Breakfast was very good and included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “4-Star Price But No 4-Star Service !”
Reviews.Author: pmprods
Reviews.Content: We picked Kette hotel because it advertised that it had its own water landing and offered to organise an airport transfer by boat. To arrive in Venice from the airport by boat seemed a very romantic thing to d,o and this was a special romantic trip for us. The hotel sent us a very nice and detailed e-mail explaining that a public water taxi from the airport should cost 100 Euros, but that the water taxi men could sometimes be unscrupulous and charge more, and also that the boats left 1km "far from the terminal". Their service was offered at 140 Euros but included a transfer to the boat by car and we wanted to avoid any hassles with unscrupulous water taxis. This was to be a trip to remember so we booked their transfer. Imagine then the disappointment when the car that met us at the terminal drove 21kms, all the way into Venice and then put us in a water taxi for the the last km to Kette Hotel ! Imagine also then how it felt when I had the temerity to complain to the staff and offered to pay 100 Euros (the normal rate for a boat all the way from the airport, which we didn't get anyway) instead of 140 Euros, and ended-up with all the staff one by one coming and ganging-up in me, finally being pursued through the lobby by one particularly large doorman shouting at me and chiding me for being so miserly over "only 40 Euros". Definitely not a 4-Star Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: cruiser035
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to St Marks Square, Bascilica, shopping, museums. Go early in the morning to any of the museums to beat the crowds. Take a windbreaker or umbrella for that sudden burst of wind or shower.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better...”
Reviews.Author: BathSquellie
Reviews.Content: We've just been on a 6 day trip to Italy. Hotel Kette was the most expensive of the three hotels (2 in Venice and 1 in Rome) we stayed in, and also the most disappointing. We arrived in Venice expecting a four star hotel, and we were a little baffled as to how the hotel had earned it's rating really. In general the service from the gentlemen at the front desk was generally dismissive and on one occasion downright rude, which was a real shame. On the plus side, the porter is a real gem! On arriving, however, we weren't given any information about the location of the hotel or even the facilities and services available other than to be told very quickly where breakfast would be served and at what time. The room we booked was a double superior room, so I kind of don't like to think what a standard room would have been like. It was very dark, at the front of the hotel and had a lovely view of a building site. Having said that, there was never any noise from it, though it was not the most attractive view! I appreciate that this aspect is out of the control of the hotel, and so it was OK really - just be aware it's what you could be looking at. The bed was averagely comfortable, though the pillows were very thin and hard. We asked for extra pillows as there were none in the room and these, to their credit, were supplied very promptly. The bathroom however, was very very small and cramped and the loo made a constant noise which you could always hear in the background. It was also disappointingly supplied with toiletries so if you are going to stay, make sure you take your own. There was nothing in the way of a bathrobe and the light on the vanity mirror did not work. The bathroom was also equipped with one of those useless hairdryer tube thingies, so if good hair is important to you, take your own! The room itself was nicely decorated, though the furniture was a bit shabby. At night however it was quiet and peaceful due to the hotel being located down a quiet street, so there was no disturbance from external noise. On the plus side, the room and the bedlinen was very clean so no complaints there. The 'public' areas of the hotel were very beautiful. However be warned that if you are a 'light' person, there isn't any natural light once you go in through the door. However it's beautifully decorated with marble, brass and dark wood, and the rooms contain lovely furniture and pictures. There are also a number of English magazines lying around on the tables which is a nice touch if you are waiting for something or just wanting to switch off for a few moments. The bar is quite expensive, but about average for the prices you pay in Venice in general. A lot of people mention the breakfast as being disappointing! We didn't think the breakfast itself was too bad at all. Nice, strong coffee and a selection of cereal, yoghurt, bread, cold-meats, boiled eggs and yes! Tinned fruit salad. There was also a selection of fresh fruit, biscuits and pastries. All the food served was very fresh, though they could have done with filling up the platters a bit more often... However, the breakfast room itself is terrible. Dimly lit, cramped and very stuffy. Also, due to the number of people staying in the hotel, it's very hectic in there - not a particularly relaxing start to the day. You needed to get out into the fresh air afterwards as the room was very hot and claustrophobic. The main thing going for this hotel is it's location. Situated on a quiet street about 5 minutes stroll from St Mark's square. Fantastic for seeing the sights and also for lovely shopping. There are also some really good restaurants and cafes around - though it is worth going a bit further away from St. Mark's square to find less expensive places to eat. Don't be fooled though Venice is not cheap and it costs you 2-3 euros to just sit at a table before you even order anything. I have to say that I wouldn't necessarily recommend this hotel to a friend as we also stayed at a different hotel which we preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ayaclio
Reviews.Content: Great location. Lovely room, had view of canal, which was very nice. Nicely maintained property. Only complaint would be as to breakfast and front desk, both lacking. The restaurant was very tight, which was of no consequence, as there were wonderful cafes around the hotel. Front desk was another matter! Not rude, just not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hopelessly inadequate dining room and very limited breakfast buffet, served grudgingly.”
Reviews.Author: Samba073
Reviews.Content: Good standard of accommodation but there were two large rooms given over to use as lounges while the two small rooms used for the buffet breakfast were hopelessly inadequate for the number of guests, both in size, table numbers and space between tables. Arriving for breakfast we were invariably unable to find two clean tables to seat our party of four. There were in total only two tables at which four guests could sit together and the poor group of seven who came down to breakfast had to virtually sit on each other's knees. The variety of food on the buffet was very limited and platters were frequently almost empty. Waiting staff frequently had to be asked to clear tables, replace empty platters etc, and could not be said to do it with good grace.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and comfortable accomodation in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: duineeiginbac
Reviews.Content: Unlike the previous contributor, I have not had the pleasure of travelling the world, but would like to say that in our experience, travelling to Venice with extended family, that we were very happy with the value we got for the three night stay in this hotel. We found the rooms adequate for a family of any height or size. The decor of the rooms would n't appeal to all tastes as they are not 'corporate image' looking bedrooms and I expect some would find them to be dated.. The location is really great. You are in the thick of it all/Venice and so near everything. During our stay there was fresh fruit available each day at the buffet. It's not as extensive a choice as you'd get in a hotel chain buty there was plenty of cereals, bread, cheese and meats and these were replaced. We came down to breakfast early each day so that may have contributed to our experience here. The hotel has a charm that we enjoyed. If you pay 'big' money for a hotel in Venice or indeed anywhere - you'll get a big room, big breakfast and big smile/greeting. Opinions differ around hotels - but I like to read contributions where the contributors resist from being rude in expressing their opinions - while 'drawf' is a technical or medical term, there may have been a kinder way to explain the matter over room size. One small matter though.....the hotel bar is lacklustre but there is such a choice outside that you do n't need a swanky joint. This is a small, comfortable hotel that is perfect for visitors to Venice that like to be outside exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for walking Venice”
Reviews.Author: Suse31
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms with air con/heating that you control. Really good breakfast - self service apart from tea/coffee. Limited drinks menu but reasonable prices for Venice. Reception desk helpful, but could appear aloof. Internet facilities allow you to pre-book your return seats, saving a lot of queing. Good mix of guests from many countries. Not all British. Near St Marks and the vaporetti. Sit on the right hand side when approaching Marco Polo for a wonderful aerial view of Venice. From airport use service bus to Piazza Roma and then vaperetto for the cheapest transport. Don't be tempted with water taxi (unless included in your package). Venice is WONDERFUL - trek around and find all the guide book favourites. Eating out is VERY EXPENSIVE try and find Roberto's or Vino Vino for reasonable priced meals. McDonalds makes for the cheapest lunch by miles!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like to be treated rudely and expect no help from the staff this is the hotel for you.”
Reviews.Author: Tomaso_10
Reviews.Content: Whoever rated this hotel 4 starts is a liar and a cheat. We had 2 rooms that would have been too small for dwarfs and the men at the front desk were unhelpful and down right rude. We've travelled the world and this was the worst hotel experience we've EVER had. That said, Venice is a beautiful city with much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal to explore the venetian islands”
Reviews.Author: ManWithSillyHat
Reviews.Content: The Kette hotel is situated just 5 mins from St Marks square (and the St Marks waterbus stop), and close to some of Venice's more expensive designer shops. The property next to the hotel is under refurb, which makes the route to the hotel look a little dull, but dont let that put you off, as its usually quiet and you soon dont even notice. Room a good size, with the occasional canal view (you may have to strain your neck round). Bathroom clean, modern and well appointed. Hotel's breakfast is definitely a plus, with an excellent continental array and good coffee service. We stayed for nearly a week and would be happy to do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it should be”
Reviews.Author: Fussey45
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Kette and overall I was left fairly disappointed as they could easily have done so much better. Unlike some of the other reviews on here, I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. That and the fantastic location is where the good times end. The rooms were noisey, both from a poor air-con system and from a building site, not ten feet from our window. The bed linen looked well past its sell by date and the bed cover looked like it needed a good wash. The breakfast for a '4 star' hotel was possibly the worst I have ever had, no hot food, pathetic service and a 'fresh' fruit cocktail straight out the tin. To top it all, the fresh juices were like paint stripper. For the price you are expected to pay, I cannot believe you wouldn't find better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, but staff need to warm up”
Reviews.Author: TonyCanada2010
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice - but small even compared to European standards, location was great - easy access to San Marco and restaurants, bar and restaurant were good (at least for the breakfast) but the who staff seemed to be a bit cold....no "Welcome to Hotel Kette!" or anything...just here's your key and there's your room. If the rooms and the location weren't as good, I would have rated it a 2 or a 1.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: 2RsNH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location, within an easy walk of San Marco and the central sites. It is attractive and comfortable - a sold three stars. The staff was helpful enough though not overly friendly. Sometimes there seemed to be a vein of tension just below the surface. They did not respond to our prior e-mail request for walking directions and it would have been difficult locating the hotel had we not arrived by water taxi. We had reserved a room for three nights but our stay was extended by five nights due to the volcano in Iceland. The hotel did accomodate us and we were grateful for that, though it appeared that they had more cancellations than extended stays. What we were most disturbed about is that they raised the rate for the last five nights, not honoring the rate at which we had originally reserved. And there was no expression of concern or sympathy for our predicament, nor offers to go out of their way to assist us. Our room would have been fine but the view from our window was of scaffolding and workmen. It was warm, there is no AC in April, and if we opened the windows and shutters during the day we were eye to eye with the workers. At night things were pretty quiet, fortunately. The breakfast buffet was okay but not outstanding in any way. It was almost exactly the same each day. The fruit was tinned; the pastries and bread never seemed perfectly fresh and empty platters were not promptly replenished. It was adequate but with a little imagination and effort could have been so much better. Again here, the staff was courteous but not friendly. That vein of tension again. The Kette may have been a very different experience if the construction was not going on right next door. But since we were there for a total of eight nights, it would have seemed that they might have honored our request for a quieter room. Our experience may have been totally different at another time. But it is a good hotel and I would recommend it to a friend. I would suggest that upon making a reservation they talk with the staff about the location of the room, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: omnipred
Reviews.Content: No free internet, but we paid 5 Euro for 24 hours access, which is not too bad. There is a free breakfast buffet that is decent. Rooms were fairly large by European standards. The hotel also includes a tour to Murano to see the glass blowing factory. You get to see a demonstration, and then they try to sell you the glass work. There's no pressure to buy the pieces, and it's a good chance to experience the water taxi ride (which is usually very expensive) for free (1-way). Just catch the water bus on the way back. You can walk to everything from the hotel's central location. We arrived via train to Venice, then took the water bus through the grand canal from the train station to the hotel. Getting from the hotel to the airport took over an hour on the water bus, so budget plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good Victorian style hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsteve12
Reviews.Content: This is a cute hotel in Venice. It looks very Victorian, but I think most in Italy do. The breakfast was good and the location is good. Staff was nice. Not much else to say good or bad, but it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Deepthinker22
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. There are just so many good things I can say about it - will try to cover all here.......... Location - wonderfully central. Just about five minutes walk into St Marks Square one way and just a little more to Academia bridge the other. It is down an alleyway that is being worked in at the moment but it is a really quiet spot despite being near to everything. Service - could not ask for better. Due to a horrid flight delay we arrived at hotel at 1.30am to be greeted by a really friendly night porter who dealt with us as quickly as he could to enable us to get off to sleep. All other staff we encountered were friendly as well and wonderfully efficient. Room - we had two rooms between the four of us (133 and 134) both looked out on the canal (granted as somebdy else has mentioned it is a narrow canal and I would imagine rooms on the higher floors would have trouble actually seeing it - but hey the majority of canals in Venice are narrow!). Both of our rooms were clean, beautifully furnished and far more spacious than we have had in some european hotels. I loved the chandelier! I took photos as I always do to add to this review but have not done so as truly the pictures on the hotel website do not tell any lies about the rooms. The minibar seemed expensive when we first looked at 3 euros for water or 6 euros for small bottle of wine until we ralised that this was actually cheaper than some of the bars out and about in Venice. Breakfast - I have no clue why anyone has complained about the breakfast at all As you arrive in the breakfast room one of the staff will ask if you want tea or coffe and they will then bring this to your table. There are two different fruit juices an water to drink as well. We had three different meats, a sliced cheese and a brie and hard boiled eggs every morning. There were four different cereals, two or three types of bread, fresh fruit and tinned fruit as well as croissants and pain au chocolats. There were also different sweet breads or cakes on each of the four mornings we had breakfast. The staff were very polite and efficient and none of us felt rushed. It was a lovely relaxing (filling) start to the day. There were a group of American travellers in the hotel at the same time as us who declared the breakfast to be the 'best of their trip so far'. Hotel in general - it is beautiful. The floor in the lobby and the reception are lovely. The lounges are sumptously decorated. These areas are quite small but were never crowded as people were mostly out and about. When on our gondola ride we went along the canal at the back of the hotel and saw the doorway where a private taxi would drop people off and even that looked wonderfully posh! Venice was lovely and when I go back I would definitely stay at the Kette again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Kette”
Reviews.Author: mcorvette
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, a little over priced. Not much to offer for breakfast for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but not brilliant - don't bother paying for a delux room”
Reviews.Author: Cyberdyne_T-101
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the location. It was easily found and was just a stone's throw from St Mark's Square. It is hidden down a back alley so is away from all the noise. It is a nice looking hotel on the inside. My main beef however is regarding the rooms, which are decidedly average. Me and my wife were staying there as part of our honeymoon and we were advised that we'd "probably" be upgraded as a result. We weren't however and when I asked to see one of the 'delux' rooms with a canal view, the room that was presented was not much bigger, with no better facilities, and the 'view' was of a brick wall opposite with a narrow and rather grubby-looking canal visible if you stuck your head out and looked straight down. This room was offered for 50 euros extra per night, then 40, but I declined. Contrary to what a lot of people have said, I thought the breakfast was very good - indeed one of the best and most varied continental breakfasts I have seen. The selection of wine is not so good. I ordered a bottle of red for the room and they had only 1 type of red wine in the hotel which was also decidedly average. If you want some drink in your room I would recommend buying it elsewhere. The staff were efficient and helpful but a bit brusque in their manner although I think this is generally the case in the city. I would summarise that this is mostly an average to fairly good place to stay in Venice, I imagine you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: KimiItalia
Reviews.Content: What a great find. So close to everything. My room was fantastic, however, some of the other group had trouble with their heating ... it was too warm. Bathrooms great. Beds great. Breakfast great. Gianni the porter was fantastic ... what a joy. Internet connection with wireless in the rooms by purchasing card for 5 euro. Fantastic find and made our trip something our group will never forget. I fell in love with Venice. Highly recommend Hotel Kette.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Amazing Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CADuck
Reviews.Content: Great location and easy to find with the directions that they provided. The interior of the hotel was exactly what I expected, detailed wood paneling and tons of marble. The staircase up to the rooms goes pretty high, we were on the third floor, but there is an elevator if you want to avoid the stairs. Our room was perfect, it overlooked a small canal. The breakfast was good, a nice variety of items, and they have extremely strong coffee, which was perfect for helping me with my jet lag. The staff at the hotel was very attentive and friendly. The location is perfect, it takes a couple minutes to walk to Piazza San Marco, and maybe five to the Rialto Bridge, depending on the amount of people walking around. The San Marco water ferry stop is only a couple of minutes away as well. Around the hotel are quite a few high end designer stores, with great window displays. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and if I ever go back to Venice, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “average 4* hotel, good location, very clean but with a poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 4cranbourne
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night in this hotel during our honeymoon and booked a junior suite with canal view for a fair supplement. the room was big enough, the canal view nice and very pittoresque, the restroom almost new. everything was extremely clean. we were disappointed for the breakfast: ours was included in the rates but the buffet was very poor with a very small choice of bread and cakes of poor quality and not a 4* standard. I am italian myself so I'm usually happy with a cold breakfast but this was really basic. the hotel is a bit old fashined and in tipical venice style so carpets, heavy curtains and glasses and is confortable. the hotel position is ok, few minutes from the La Fenice theatre and a small distance from St Mark`s square: it is definitely centrally located. hotel staff is helpful and kind

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cdscons
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Very easy access from ferry terminal, although it rained heavily when we arrived. Central location close to everything. Front desk very obliging, as was the room staff. Value OK for a 4 star, thought the breakfast was fine. Internet access should be free, not EU4 per hour. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was quite roomy with a great bathroom (actual bath!), and a sitting room which was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bonesthetraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within easy walking distance to St. Mark's and the Grand Canal. It is your typical European hotel with small rooms, but very clean. Our room was one of the few with two windows, one opening to a small balcony. You could see and hear the gondolers on the canal. The provided breakfast, was again, very European. Everything was fresh. The wait staff could have been a little more friendly, however. The front desk staff went out of their way to answer any questions, set up tours, and give directions. We would stay there again and have recommended this to our travel agent and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap service with a smile. Nickel and Dime you...”
Reviews.Author: Pvitaver
Reviews.Content: My breakfast was included on the daily rate, but not the cappuccino (4 euros for a small one), I tried to take my own paid breakfast to my room, they stopped me, they took my platter with 2 croissants away, and told me that it is hotel policy not to let me take my breakfast to my room, because of 'accidents' in the past. Solution: they will bring it up (one floor) and charge me 5 EC extra per person, for the 'favor of protecting me'. Just another gimmick to yet squeeze another $15 from me on a paid breakfast (plus $12 for two sorry cappuccinos). I don't mind the 370 EC I paid per day (3 days), but I don't want to be ripped off! Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Damamar
Reviews.Content: The Kette Hotel is a four star hotel, but is very clean and neat. we felt very vey confortable at this hotel. Our room was big and just precious, romantic and inspiring. The bathroom was big and beautiful, well loaded with everything needed to make us feel great. This trip was to us as a second honeymoon and it accomplished the porpuse very nicely, we are glad we stay at his hotel, centrally located and at the same time away from the canal noises. One thing very important about The Kette HOtel is very well located, centrally located, literally just 5 minutes away from every important site all tourist must visit in Venezia: San Marks Piazza, Rialto Bridge. The Bridge of Sights, The Beautiful Cathedral of San Marks, and many other atractions in Venezia. And also, is just steps away from the shopping district and many good restaurants. The Kette Hotel is a great deal especially they breakfast is just delicious. There is nothing bad about this hotel. We may not be able to list everything we should but we do recommend The Kette Hotel and certainly we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ahuffington
Reviews.Content: It was very centrally located. Very quaint. We had a corner room, with a view of the canal. It was amazing. Our stay was perfect. The front desk was very obliging. I would totally stay there again and strongly recommend it to friends. The view and location is what we loved best. We felt totally comfortable with taking our afternoon nap here before setting off for the evening dinner and stroll. It was very nice to stay off the main canal - since it was located on a smaller canal it was much quieter, so when we did want to nap or sleep it was perfect. The breakfasts that are included with the rooms are never that great anywhere you go, so that was pretty standard (we don't ever typically do breakfast at our hotel anyway/where).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOzz
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location close to St Mark's Cathedral and incredible staff. Highly recommended. A bit downside was that you had to pay extra if you wanted coffee in your breakfast which I didn't expect from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “get room 501”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjamesone
Reviews.Content: Found a good last minute deal on Octopus but wanted to make it special so I emailed them and they upgraded me to a Deluxe Room (Number 501) for a small extra fee. This room is very nice with a nice big bed, TV, fridge and chairs. The bathroom is lovely with a nice deep bath and all the trimmings. Whats made the room so special though was the lovely private terrace attached to this room - not sure if any other rooms have anything similar. The terrace was twice as big as the room itself and had views over the city, you can see St Marks bell tower and the top of the Basillica which is only 300 metres away. Its a perfect spot for having breakfast (which we went out and bought ourselves at 20% of the price you would pay in the hotel) and enjoyed it sitting in our bathrobes! Its also a great spot for a bottle of wine or chamapgne in the afternoon... Location is great, in San Marco, not far from the ferry stop. Cost was reasonable considering it was Venice! Staff were ok. They were very helpful when emailing them to get the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: crazypom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Kette in late August. Good size superior room ticked all the boxes. Nice canals views from room but don't forget the canals are the roads of Venice so expect noise from boats etc. at all hours (6am trash collections). Staff were friendly and efficient and beakfast in the small dining room was pleasant. We took a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotel, definately the way to arrive and depart. All in all a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “60th Wedding Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Sofisticat
Reviews.Content: My husband, parents, sister and brother-in-law went to Venice to celebrate my parent's 60th Wedding Anniversary. Venice was truly wonderful. Hotel Kette could not have been more pleasant. It's very near St Mark's but is fairly quiet, being slightly down a back street/canal.!! The hotel staff were extremely pleasant, helpful and kind. I'd highly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay, not far from all attractions. Go, it's wonderful....!!

Reviews.Title: “Kette - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: lotusjim
Reviews.Content: Three nights in Venice made perfect by having the Kette Hotel as base. The staff are excellent, attentive and helpful. Our room was very comfortable with en-suite, all facilities and overlooked the canal, with gondolas and singing gondoliers adding to the ambience. Breakfast was included and matched the quality of the hotel service. Location is ideal, only five minutes stroll from St Marks Square and with easy, shop lined walks to all other places of interest such as Rialto Bridge. Our thanks to Marco, Michele, Riccardo and friends. We recommend the Kette with confidence, and we shall return. Maureen and Mike Evans, Gold Coast, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “The Magic of Venice”
Reviews.Author: BridgeOfSighs
Reviews.Content: Years ago I lived in Venice for three months, later visiting with my young son and now , for the third time with my husband. For me Venice has never lost its' magic. Marco and Michele of the Hotel Kette were charming . Our room overlooked a canal where the gondalas came past with their cargo of tourists and the sound of bells from the campanile in St Mark's Square completed the atmosphere that is uniquely Venice. The only changes I noticed were the designer name shops of Gucci , Chanel , Louis Vuitton , Fendi , and many more ( hide your credit cards if you wish ) which were all within a few moments walk of the hotel , as indeed is St Marks' . We could go out for the day exploring streets and squares full of wonderful architecture , returning to the hotel to shower and change. Then dine at one of many restaurants nearby and end the night having coffee and listening to an orchestra in the square before strolling back . There is so much more to see in the surrounding areas , one needs more than the few days we enjoyed so much.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: jenlaw
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very attentive and the hotel was nice and clean. However, our room had only views of brick walls and was very dark. They do not include breakfast like most other hotels, however the location is wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: cindylane123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with 9 other friends...we had a wonderful time. The staff was friendly and helpful, and could not have been nicer. They gave us great recommendations for places to eat, all great. The location was superb...we walked virtually everywhere...it was right at St. Sarks square, couldn't have been better.
