Nice breakfast in the morning...we just had the best time. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Simply terrible”
Reviews.Author: Tantounette
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly but in our 2-days stay in this hotel, we never had ... yes... HOT WATER. Can you imagine??? A 4-star hotel!!! We had a cabin shower so small that we could hardly move, and in the room of my children, it was smelling so bad that we thought seriously to change the hotel. The breakfast was poor. The only good thing was its location I hated Venice because of this hotel. It deserves a maximun of 2 stars...

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: ab0000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent quiet location, about a 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and 10 minutes to the Rialto Bridge. The hotel's staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was excellent by Italian standards and is included in our room rate. Our corner room had views of the small canal through smallish windows that open but the truth is that you don't spend very much time in your room so you'll have to make a decision as to whether or not the difference in price is worth it. Remember you are surrounded by canals wherever you walk. The room was a little dated and could use some upgrading like better mattress and pillows. But having said that, we slept like babies. In this price category, we felt that it was 'worth' the money according to Venice prices. We ate most of our dinners at restaurants along the Grand Canal beside the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: sidkels
Reviews.Content: Not an over impressive place. The room was small and the bathroom was even smaller. The bathroom was difficult to manuveur because there's not shower door/curtain so the entire area got wet. The breakfasts were absolutely ridiculous in price so we never ate there. We liked that the room was on the canal and we could watched the gondolas and other boats. The staff was OK. The internet was 5 Euros and there was often a line there. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: debjen321
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent! Room was great with canal view! Beautiful!!! Close to everything!! Breakfast was very good! We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: KimH925
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Kette greeted us w/ unparalelled service and friendliness. The sitting rooms, dining room and hotel rooms were vibrantly done just as you would expect in grand Italian style!! The hotel is a short walk to everything you need to do while in Venice. A 5 minute walk to Basilica San Marco in St. Mark's Square, which is not to be miss in your trip!! Just around the corner on the Grand Canal you will find vendor shopping, canal side eateries and many tours taking you to Murano, Burano and Torcello. Not to mention the gondola rides that take you through the meandering canals that make up beautiful, romantic VENICE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Ideal Base”
Reviews.Author: waxer666
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel Kette,it is perfectly located close to St Marks and Vaparetto stops and a great place for a base to tour Venice,staff where efficient and friendly,room small but comfy and with a nice view of canal and we would definately return.The Adjacent shops are a little scary price wise,all Prada,Gucci, etc but its nice to look in the window. We ate the first night at La Caravella restaurant which is just around the corner,mighty pricey but a very very good meal if you want cheap and cheerfull try the student area at the back of Academia we had an espresso for 80p which in Venice is unbelievably cheap and the G&T`s where just under Â£5.

Reviews.Title: “Our second trip to the Kette and just as fabulous as the first!!”
Reviews.Author: goldielocks&the2boys
Reviews.Content: Well, ignore the Americans - I'm not too sure what they're looking for in a hotel, perhaps a constant stream of 'have a nice day' and falseness!! The staff were pleasant and polite but not in an insincere way. We were handed a map of Venice as we checked in and were asked if it was our first time. It wasn't, but I'm sure if it had been they would have recommended places to visit. We had the room with the crappiest view (room 141) but we weren't there for the view, the room was just to sleep and bath/shower in. For this it was perfectly fine. Absolutely immaculately clean and yes, the bed could have done with two pillows, but if you walk around Venice as much as me and my husband did then you won't care what you're sleeping on!!! The breakfast was lovely, plenty of selection and beautiful strong coffee with steamed milk. The hotel warned us one evening that the water lever would rise and advised us to wear suitable footwear - I really cannot fault them at all. When we checked out, we still had a couple of hours to kill before going to the airport and they were more than happy to look after our luggage. We went to the Kette for the first time on our first anniversary in 2000 when it was newly renovated and coming back nine years later didn't disappoint. I wouldn't hesitate to book again. I'm not going to do a review of Venice or how much it cost (was horrendously expensive but worth it) as this is purely a review of the hotel. Let's just say - we WILL be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but expensive”
Reviews.Author: shaznian
Reviews.Content: we travelled to Venice over the Valentines weekend and coincidentally also the Venice Carnival weekend !! Venice is beautiful, we have travelled a bit now and l havent seen anywhere like it so l am really pleased we went. Our hotel was lovely, clean, good food, lovely staff, i really cant fault them at all. l would sincerely recommend that you fill up totally at breakfast, food and drink are so expensive here, very small portions and expect to pay 6.50euro + for a cup of coffee and around 15 - 20 euros per person for lunch without drinks. The hotel Kette is fantastically placed just behind san marco square so literally 5 min slow walk away. We were lucky enough to have a room with a view onto one of the back canals so we could see gondolas all the time up and down but the down side was even though it was bitterly cold it still smelled a bit now and again !! The rooms are quite small but adequate and bathroom was excellant and large. Good selection at breakfast, 3 types of cheese, 3 hams, pate, croissants, rolls , cake , fruit, yoghurt, 3 cereals, juice etc. pillows are awful, flat and hard !!! tv mainly German and Italian, seems the brits only watch the news and sport !!! thats all you get anyway in english !! Venice is beautiful and we were mesmerised by the Rialto bridge you really could be in any century standing there its as if time stands still. we didnt take a gondola they were 80 euros for 30 min and the euro was strong against the pound . Â£1 was 0.83 euro . they also took tourists round the back canals rather than the grand canal although there were hundreds of gondolas on the grand canal but we didnt ask the price possibly more i would think. the carnival is brilliant, the costumes, masks and the effort they put in. the "angelo " that comes down from the town is fantastic, a girl on a wire in a flowing long dress and the most spectacular gold feather wings, she was so brave she descends slowly and it is some height !!! if you get chance to go on carnival weekend do its fantastic. unfortunately it is very expensive we found a chinese (i know not really italian but what the heck it was in our price range ) which was pretty much uk price and the food was good. there is a mc donalds but its Â£10 for a big mac meal !!! dont get on a water taxi unless you really can afford it Â£143 one way transfer from the airport to hotel !!! water bus Â£50 return for 2 from airport to hotel so better value all round. have a look in gucci, channel, louis vuitton its amazing so are the prices !!!! lots of murano glass but go to murano island to buy it its much cheaper. we loved Venice but we doubt we would go back as we have seen all we wanted but i would recommend it and definately the hotel KETTE. a win on the lottery wouldnt be a bad idea before you go !!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!!!”
Reviews.Author: zia8
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I had booked this hotel through a travel agent, and we are sorry we did. This was our 3rd stop in our Italy vacation. We were not impressed at all, especially coming from amazing hotels in the other cities. The only positive things I can say is that the room was clean,and it is a great location but not too much more. The rooms were small and dingy and had an overwhelming smell of perfume. The beds were hard as boards-I actually considered sleeping on the floor- and we too heard a buzzing noise like someone else had mentioned throughout the night. Everything looked old, from the furniture to the comforters. . old not antique! There was one gentleman at the front desk who checked us in who was very friendly. Everyone else that we came in contact with or asked a question to was very arrogant and huffed when I asked him if we could see a map. I just think for the amount of money, there are nicer places that you can stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: TonyLadonie
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights for our 25th anniversary our stay was very nice our room was on the small side but very good guality the staff where very polite and helpful the water taxi stoped right at the door , lifts to our floor ,nice lounge areas to sit in downstairs exellent location near san marco sq the brekfast room was small but you could eat as much as you wanted. Our only dissapointment was at a resturant near by called the Antico Martini near the opera house the meal was expensive but poor in quality .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: CarolynOntario
Reviews.Content: I am asthmatic, and I was worried that I would find Venice damp and therefore difficult to breathe. Our travel agent did an excellent job finding hotels that were clean and updated throughout our stay in Italy and this hotel was excellent in that regard. It has a water side entrance which is charming as we arrived to our hotel by water taxi, and then it has a street side entrance. The hotel is situated right in the centre of the island. A 5 minute walk from Piazza San Marco, the Doges Palace etc. Shopping and restaurants are abundant within 1 minute of the hotel door. The room was very westernized. Large bathroom with tub and shower. Be prepared to spend money here. Once you are on the island you are going to pay a lot of money for food etc. the gondola rides are within a few minutes of the hotel. the staff here could have been a bit more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: furni
Reviews.Content: The location is good but that is all I can say that is favorable. The front desk clerk had a raging cold, (sneezing, blowing his nose everywhere) which he was happy to pass on to me so I could be sick for the rest of my travels, he was also extemely arrogant even when asked a simple question. One morning when the hotel was full there was no hot water for our showers. The rooms are small and the hair dryer was the worst. I believe there are nicer places to stay in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Kette”
Reviews.Author: galavantinggranny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kette for a short break from 4-7th Sept 2008. We booked the hotel through airmiles and were very happy with our choice . We traveled to Marco Polo with Easyjet and opted for the hotels airport transfer service which we booked directly with them . We were met at the airport by a car and driver and driven to the Piazzale Roma where there was a water taxi waiting to take us directly to the hotel's water enterance . It was a bit pricey at 140 euros but we felt it was worth it for the convenience and speed. I had emailed the hotel and asked for a canalview room and we were allocated room226 which was a corner room with two windows overlooking a small canal much frequented by gondaliers . We enjoyed watching them going by sometimes accompanied by an accordionist providing music. The room was very pleasant with minibar and safe . The safe was operated using a magnetic card strip so we opted for our Tesco clubcard and left our credit cards safely inside. The bathroom was quite adequate with a shower, small bathtub and hairdryer. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are lots of places to eat nearby . We ate at La Caravella at the Saturnia & International hotel and this meal was definately the most enjoyable . We also ate at La Cusina ,at The Westin Europa and Regina and The Grand Canal restaurant at the hotel Monaco. The hotel provides a continental breakfast which is served in a very small breakfast room and had the usual fare of yogurts, cold meats , boiled eggs cheeses and croissants . There is also a bar and lounge with internet access. The hotel is ideally situated close to San Marco and we usually opted to round off our evening listening to the music in the Piazza before returning to the hotel . We found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and helpful particularily the porter.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: egator1996
Reviews.Content: Me and my two friends found this hotel on Expedia. We traveled Italy for 2 weeks. We were pleasantly surprised how friendly and helpful the staff was. Our room was nice and the location was great. Close to St. Marks square but far enough to be quiet. The breakfast was good. I would recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “Suited the Requirements”
Reviews.Author: MersonTuffers
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Venice for his 40th birthday & we arrived on 12th August. Thanks to some excellent directions from a fellow Forum subscriber we found the hotel with ease. Without those instructions I think we may have struggled a bit as it is hiding up a small alleyway from the main throughfare. Check-in was efficient. That's the only way to describe it. Friendliness is definitely in short supply at this hotel. Polite efficiency is the order of the day. If, like me, you are a chatty friendly person who likes to exchange a few pleasant words whilst handing in your key in the morning you will be left feeling a bit deflated as the staff quite simply will not respond to you. And it was not a language thing either. Our room was very nice but a bit on the small side. When you have a six foot, six inch tall & solidly built husband, you definitely notice room size. We were delighted with the shutters onto the canal which were excellent at keeping out the early morning sunshine and ensuring a longer lie in the morning to recover from all the walking the day before!! The bathroom was also petite but very clean and quite serviceable. The shower took a bit of working out but we got there in the end. We found the bed to be very firm which did result in sore backs when we were getting up in the mornings. As mentioned in other reviews the breakfast room is not the biggest but we never had any problem getting a table. The waiters were also very 'efficient'. The buffet selection was adequate with a selection of three cereals, three cheeses, three meats, fruit cocktail (tinned) and fresh fruit. The was a quite small selection of bread / rolls/ croissants along with small individual sized 'cakes'. This was probably the smallest buffet selection for breakfast that I have encountered but ,given the size of the breakfast room, any bigger would have left no space for the tables. Finally, the location of the Kette is good. Being August, it was fairly warm (for us anyway!) and this hotel is great for being able to go out exploring for a couple of hours and then pop back to cool down for half an hour or so in your bedroom before heading out again. We didn't use any of the other communal rooms so can't pass comment on them but they looked pleasant enough when we looked in on them. So, to sum up, an attractive hotel with efficient staff, pleasant rooms (some of which might be a bit small) and an adequate breakfast. It suited our requirements but we would probably choose a different hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Travlin2
Reviews.Content: We were VERY PLEASED with our stay at the Hotel Kette in Venice. We were there 3 days/nights. Very centrally located, yet off the "beaten path" of the regular and busy pedestrian traffic. If you weren't staying there, you probably wouldn't never run into it or know it's even there. Aprox, 5-7 minute walk to St. Mark's and about 10-12 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. That is if you don't stop and look in every shop and window along the way. The front desk staff was nice, friendly, and helpful. However, they really didn't "volunteer" or provide you with too much info. unless you initiated a question or greeting. but, no big deal. The breakfast was light and simple and the breakfast staff was good and attentive - providing drinks and clearing dishes as needed. The Breakfast room is very small and may not have enough seats if you hit it at the wrong time. We were fortunate enough to find a table each of our 3 mornings. However, as more people came, some were left "looking" for a place to sit. The hotel itself is small and has a unique inside structural design. The floors (3rd floor for example) is at different levels itself. You may be taking steps up or steps down - after leaving the elevator - and still be on the 3rd floor. It was an interesting set-up. Our room was nice, but smaller than a typical hotel room. Not a lot of room to even walk around. However, the accomodations within were fine. Our room was #314 and was the top room above the main entrance. Still haven't figured out how our room was at the top and yet there were 5 floors (we were on the 3rd). In any case, we could see the bell tower (Campanile) and the very top of the Basilica in St. Mark's square. Also, we could view a portion of a close by canal that always seemed to have Gondola activity. Again, the location of this hotel, we thought, was OUTSTANDING!! The bathroom was very small yet satisfactory. The bed was fine. The air conditioner worked perfectly - and for the weather we were experiencing, we were grateful. No extra outlets. We needed to unplug a lamp and/or TV to use an outlet. like I said, it was a pretty small room. Overall, we were VERY PLEASED with our 3 day stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Eh? Nice location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaTaft
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Kette because our travel agent got us a deal. It was o-kay. Few things. 1. The front desk took our passports upon check in and hung onto them for an entire day - until the next day. We didn't encounter this anywhere else is Europe. Is that normal? 2. The bathroom only has one outlet - and it's specifically for electric shavers. No other appliances are allowed/work in the bathroom. I had to blow dry my hair in a corner on the floor of the room. If I had known that fact alone, I would not have stayed here. 3. We could not figure out how to shower and not get water all over the floor. We used all our towels every morning, mopping up the mess. 4. They make you return your hotel key before you leave the hotel. Again, is this normal? Maybe it is, and we don't know. But thought it was strange. 5. The only have one iron for the entire hotel. If no one is using it, you're in luck. If not, then you're out of luck. 6. Supposedly this hotel is 4 stars. I guess by European standards? I would rate it a 2.5 in the states or at least in LA. Maaayyybe a 3. Definetly not 4. It was great having a water dock and not having to drag our luggage through out Venice, but if we go back - we're not staying here again. It was just o-kay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Kette”
Reviews.Author: Agent717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Kette prior to a cruise to Greece. The location was perfect for seeing San Marco, and centrally located on Venice Island. The hotel was a real gem in this very pricey city. Rates at $200 USD are considered very moderate for Venice, so I was not expecting much. What we experienced was a fabulous, well managed hotel, with lovely Italian decor, and charming helpful staff. The location could not have been more perfect. If arriving by plane, and want to arrive right at the hotel's back door (along the canal) then opt for a private water taxi. An extra expense, but well worth NOT having to cart your own luggage through the streets, (which is not far from the vaporetta stop), but it a little difficult to maneuver over the bridges with steps). Once you get the hang of getting around and familiarize yourself with Venice, you can save by taking the much less expensive vaporetta back to the airport-or train station. The breakfast room was small, but very functional since not all the guests were eating breakfast at the same time. We felt the offerings for breakfast were EXCELLENT. Very European with their quality meats and cheeses, but these were fresh and tasty, and the flaky croissants were delightful. There was fresh fruits and cereals and decadent pastries, so there is something there to please everyone. The coffee was quite good, and there was a choice of two different juices-orange and apple. The rooms were beautifully decorated, and the bedding was quite comfortable. I think this is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying at ...”
Reviews.Author: TavelAddict
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights stay at the Kette Hotel in Venice. Great Location, 5min walk to San Marco Piazza, but far enough away to be very quiet at night. We had a superior room on the 4th floor overlooking the canal, definitely book one of these as they are really nice and spacious rooms and have a great view of the boats going by. Hotel is very clean and tidy, good polite and helpful staff. Breakfast was included in the price and was your typical continental style, ie. ham, cheese, bread and croissants, but was more than adequate. There's a great restaurant called Vino Vino, 2mins walk from the hotel (turn right out of hotel and cross over bridge, restaurant is on the corner). You can't book, so you may have to wait, but worth it. Food and service is excellent. Would highly recommend this hotel and would be more than happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would we stay again?”
Reviews.Author: GreyhoundSurrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located close to the Alilguna stop at San Marco from the airport. Hotel rooms are clean and quite comfortable. There is a problem at breakfast, the hotel has 62 rooms - ie probably 100+guests and there is room for about 45 in the dining room which is small and has tables very close together. Most mornings, people had to queue for a table. Would we stay again - probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindale
Reviews.Content: By carefully searching the internet we got a fantastic deal at The Kette Hotel, including a great breakfast â€“ and when we arrived we found that we had been given a suite comprising of lounge, (glass chandelier, table, settee, chairs, mini bar/fridge) bedroom (very large bed, TV, wardrobe, glass chandelier) overlooking a canal with occasional gondoliers singing as they passed by, and en-suite bathroom (toilet, bidet, bath with two showers, hair dryer). The hotel was spotlessly clean and well presented with attentive and helpful staff. Breakfast was buffet style with stacks of foods on offer â€“ including fruit juices, yoghurts, fruit, meats, cheeses, eggs, super cakes, and numerous other items. Fill up at breakfast and you donâ€™t need another meal until the evening! On the down side, the bed was rather firm and the pillow hard. The room lacked drink making facilities (we always take our own kettle), and surprisingly there was no visitor information or tourist map available in the room. Hotel Kette was well positioned a short walk from St Markâ€™s Square. The location was quiet and all the delights of Venice were within easy reach. I do recommend getting a water taxi from the airport to the hotel. It is a great way to arrive Venice and guarantees that you find your hotel. I would happily stay at The Kette again, and would have no trouble in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Komfortable Kette”
Reviews.Author: dezzer
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel direct, you get a discount on early reservations and you still dont have to pay up front. We went for a superior room and it was good- size was ok, beds were comfortable but the elusive hotel soft pillow still alluded us, the bathroom worked with plenty of hot water. Overall the standard is fresh, clean, nice marble and units in the bathroom good standard. Style is antiquey, stirpey wallpaper, dark wood, subtle bed curtains see photos, not to my taste, and strangely the bed seemed quite low to the floor, but hey this is picky, It was fine, no complaints. Breakfeast was good, all that you expect, rolls hams, juices etc, - very good. Location excellent for either a first time in Venice or you need to be near a central location. Staff on desks were efficient and organised- in line with the Austrian background to the hotel i guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: bjspa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in room 141. I got a bargain rate on otel.com (A$197 per night) but I think I got what I paid for. Positives: - conveniently located near the vaporetto, you can take either 1 or 82 there and get off at Piazza San Marco - the team was very helpful and pleasant, checking us in and booking a tour - close to Piazza San Marco, only a few minutes walk - close to shops, it's just up the lane from Gucci, what amused me was the street vendors selling fakes brazenly out the front of the authentic high-end shops - clean - tidy room Not so great: - the room was dark and looked onto a wall (as I said, I may have got what I paid for) - the bed was HORRIBLE and dipped in the middle. I would have had to change hotels if we were there for more than 2 nights - there was this 'noise', at first I thought it was drilling but then I think I figured out it was the noise from the elevator going up and down AND we weren't even located near the elevator so the noise carried - the only thing I could see that would equal an 'American breakfast' was a boiled egg. There was also no fresh juices. There were nice pastries, fresh meats, cheeses etc. - there is NO WAY this is a 4 star hotel This was probably the worst hotel room of our one month stay. Thank goodness we had ear plugs. For once in my life I didn't provide feedback to the hotel team directly (to my husband's relief) as I didn't think there was much they can do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Kerri-Ann
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location, friendly & warm staff, lovely room, a good continental breakfast offering cereal, pastries with jams and cooked meats! We had a wonderful 3 nights stay at Hotel Kette, easy to find - get off the waterbus at San Marco, walk down the street to the left which is also the left of Harry's Bar. At the end turn left, walk over the bridge and just after the Snack bar turn right - at the end is Hotel Kette!

Reviews.Title: “not so bad but ...”
Reviews.Author: paris0708
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days in that hotel (family 4 people) booked 2 seperate rooms one superior and one deluxe, in fact no need to take the deluxe since there is a additional room not necessary that seperates the room from the tiny bathroom very well located, but poor breakfast comparing to the room prices (160â‚¬ and 190â‚¬) !! no swimming pool or gym room !!! Don't you ever go to the restaurant beside the hotel called Vino Vino and neither to the sort of 5 stars restaurant adjacent to the Vino Vino. We accidentaly went to the Vino Vino on the 24rh where we were very badly served and treated by a crazy waiter, shouting and screaming at his colleagues and very agressive with us. He did not speak English Correctly and did not speak French, unfortunately we did not speak Italian well ! We paid 80â‚¬ for a meal eaten under stress where the Lasagna were cold, served without parmesiano neither a knive & fork, plus the veal was so thiny that we left this hotel hungry !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PortoLiberty
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, 2 adults and two kids, 13 and 11 years old, stayed in 2 rooms next to each other. Venice was very cold. The hotel was easy too find (we use the map from the internet site of the hotel). From the Marco Polo airport, take the bus number 5 and leave at the P. Roma. There take the vaporetto 82 or 1 and leave at S marcos square and follow the map...The hotel was ok. The breakfast room is small, but we always had a table. The staff was ok. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Magic of Venice”
Reviews.Author: DonnieHossack
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 4 night stay at this hotel and the only fault we could find was the rather hard bed in our room but don't know if this was standard or just that we were unlucky.Another minor observation was that the breakfast room was rather small for the number of rooms in the hotel so this could be a problem in the busy summer months.For those of you who don't need a cooked breakfast in the morning then the choice on offer was ideal.The Hotel is ideally situated for shops and restaurants but there again most of the hotels in Venice are because you will not be very far from the many Waterbus stops in the city.I would recommend purchasing a Venice Card at the airport which gives you unlimited access to all the waterbuses and for a small extra charge you get access to all the museums,theatres etc.The only thing that surprised me was that I was only asked for my ticket once out of the many trips I took on the waterbus(maybe I just have an honest face).The hotel is not the easiest to find especially in the dark and even the shops not far from the hotel give you a blank look when asked so if that is a concern then you would be best getting a water taxi which takes you right there.I would ceratinly return to this hotel if I returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brmoulin
Reviews.Content: Excelent Localization. Excelent Bedroom. Excelent Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MissWhitey
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a hen weekend with 11 women and we all had a great time. Out of all 6 rooms none of us had a problem and all seemed very happy. The rooms were very clean, and nice modern bathrooms. I think a couple may have had trouble with the hot water from the shower being intermittent but our room was fine. Breakfast was really lovely with fresh, still warm from the oven, croissants and fresh fruit, cheese & ham, preserves, cereal, tea and coffee. It's a small room though so get down early to avoid having to queue to get in. We were up and out early though because there was so much we wanted to do. The location is absolutely great. Less than 5 mins to St. Marks Square and within easy reach of everything. We got a water taxi from the airport direct to the hotel door which was perfect. One tip....don't have coffee in St. Marks Square. It was a total rip off at about Â£14 each for just a coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MauiWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Kette. With lack of directions on hotel confirmation papers, we took almost 1 hour to find the place. When reading addresses in Venice, the name following the number, is the area or island that the business in on. The second name is the street name. Long story short, if you're in San Marco with your back facing the canal, head left, straight out of San Marco. There is a Louis Vuitton shop on the right; keep heading straight past all the designer shops and over 1 bridge. The second and third alley will take you to the Hotel Kette, located on S. Moise. We had a larger room (201), with 10 foot ceilings and a canal view. It was so nice to watch gondola riders strolling by and once in a while treated to an accordian and singer. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. Take advantage of the complimentary water taxi to Murano. After that, you're on your own if you want to go to Burano and back to Venice. If you're flying out of Venice, you have to pay 100 euros for the private water taxi to shuttle you to the airport drop off point. Men with hand trucks greet you and offer you a 20 euro ride to the airport. Don't take it! Just walk it (took under 10 minutes on flat, smooth, semi-covered walkways).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff is hit-or-miss”
Reviews.Author: nyc_to_everywhere
Reviews.Content: The Kette hotel is in a fantastic location and is a very nice small hotel. Good breakfast, too. For the price of the room, however, we received pretty rude service by one particular person at the front desk, although the rest were nice. Also, if you're asking for restaurant recommendations, there *seems* to be an agreement with one or two restaurants, because I heard them suggest the same ones to several people. One of them - the one we went to on their suggestion - was fine, but not fantastic. I don't know if they help each other out or what, but you're better off using a tour book (Rick Steves' is particularly good) to get absolutely objective options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bellahols
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Kette and were really pleased with it. The room was a good size, comfortable and clean. The large bathroom was well equipped with both a bath and a shower. The best feature of the room was the view from our window â€“ which overlooked the canal, early evening was very romantic when you could see the gondolas and hear the musicians playing their accordions. The hotel was in a perfect position easy to find and very close to San Marco square and the designer shops. Rialto Bridge was also easy to reach on foot - for us the only way to explore is on foot. To eat out it can be expensive but like anywhere if you have a look round and wander down some of the side streets you can find some good and inexpensive restaurants. The only problem we had was getting to the airport â€“ please be aware there are two airports in Venice and the water bus only goes to Marco Polo airport and not Traviso!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: davidleeds
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Kette and were delighted with it. Our choice had a lot to do with the hotel being in a quiet area. When we arrived earlier than the regular check-in time our room was ready. The hotel knew we wanted a quiet room and mentioned it was not on the canal for that reason which was fine with us. Yes, the room was small but in terms of large cities it was fine with a bathroom that had bathtub with a shower and a glass door versus the usual shower curtain. The bed was comfortable but I did bring my own pillow after reading about pillows being hard in Italy and I was glad I did. The breakfast room was small as noted in reviews but we always found a seat and there was plenty of choice in food. We had no trouble finding the hotel from the map on the web site and the location is excellent. We would stay here again. In tems of Venice the price of food is shockingly high and everywhere else in Italy seems a bargin. The most important thing is to get to the remote areas where the locals live to really enjoy the feel of Venice away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Kette, Venice”
Reviews.Author: spudDorset
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel to be clean, centrally placed and ideal for walking round Venice. Approximately 5 minutes from the San Marco drop off for the airport public water taxi, the hotel was easy to find and located in a nice area. Also around 5 minutes from San Marco so just far enough away to avoid the hustle and bustle of the crowds. Don't be disappointed with the lack of views around the hotel - not many of the hotels in Venice have views. Our room (416) was quiet and of a reasonable size. The hotel has two lifts so no problems getting up and down. Stay clear of San Marco when looking for places to eat - head to Dorsoduro and find one of the many street cafes and don't be frightened to head down small narrow alleys - great fun to explore and amazing what you see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: HonestTravelerNJ
Reviews.Content: The Kette was a perfect small hotel. The staff was professional and educated in all aspects of the area - restaurants, etc - which was helpful. The room had nice quality linens, decor and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was also modern and clean. The room and bathroom were by no means large but that is to be expected in most cities. It was large enough for us not to feel cramped. The other great aspect was the location. It was around the corner from all of the shops, but in a quiet area. I would absolutely stay there again! And be ready...Venice is quite expensive. Gondola rides are 100 euros for 30 minutes. We also took a water taxi ride for 10 minutes that cost 70 euros. They were both amazing and worth it. The budget-conscious can stick to the water bus, or by foot, which is what we did and a great way to explor!

Reviews.Title: “Just an average stay...”
Reviews.Author: adatrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #501; it has a wonderful patio that overlooks the rooftops & clock tower. Other than the patio, location & cleanliness, it just average. The patio was bigger than the room; the room is almost like a rooftop dungeon. The only way to get light in the room is to open the patio doors but it was about 50 degrees (out of luck there). The bed was lumpy and the pillow must have been made of concrete, so hard and heavy. The bathroom was so tiny, one step from the toilet to the shower. We tried to have breakfast at the hotel but the room was so tightly packed, so we decided to go elsewhere. It was a shame we had to pay for breakfast since it was included with hotel stay. The staff was helpful and the hotel has it own private dock, perfect it you take a private water taxi and have luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room. Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nanma
Reviews.Content: Having seen the reviews here I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, it is in the best location to see all of what Venice has to offer. I found this hotel to be better than I anticipated. The second floor room (226 with a bath as well as a shower) had the perfect view from two windows, was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. My first trip to Venice and a good hotel helps to make a good holiday. The only problem I had was finding the hotel on the first day, I soon realised that I was not alone with this problem, every day I saw people with suitcases and map in hand looking for their hotel and not just the Kette. It was perfectly situated, because of my illness I have to rest often so with the hotel being in the centre of everything I could go back during the day for a rest and then set out again in the afternoon. I saw more of Venice than I thought I would be able to and I believe the comfort and position of this hotel was the main factor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, superb staff, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Millwallmark
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Venice and did not know what to expect. Had been recommended the Kette by travel agent and did not let us down. The room was immaculate - wish I had had a bath as well as a shower though - and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Also, it was just about possible to fill up with enough breakfast to last you most of the day if you wanted, a good selection of cereals, meats, cheeses, rolls, croissants, fruit, juices, coffees, yoghurts and cakes. And as for the location - it could not have been better. Just five mins from San Marco square and all the shops - but lovely and quiet all the time. And the aircon was good too! Thanks too all at the Kette for making the stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Luke warm on the Kette”
Reviews.Author: PPAinsworth
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in July 2007. Room on first floor had a resident mosquito , ineffective aircon , and a noisy saniflow type waste disposal system, so we had very little sleep on the first night. We were moved to a room on the third floor ,after I complained, and this was better. Breakfast was unremarkable. The hotel location was its best aspect, and given that it was Venice,was also reasonable value for the money we paid. Nevertheless we will not return in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: cindyness
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Venice a few years before, and URG, it was a terrible experience. It was too far to anything nice, it had no air conditioning, etc. The Kette was everything and more. Our travel agent recommended it, and it was awesome. We had a great view overlooking the canal, it was super close to St. Mark's Square, and the staff were so ever friendly and helpful. Our room was just the right size, with a nice big bathroom, and air conditioning for those oh so hot summer nights. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who really wants to live the Venetian Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marianna_greece
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 nights there and it was very nice. Nothing big and over luxurious but everything was nice and clean. Our room was very nicely decorated with a spotless bathroom at the the end of a wide corridor. The corridor itself had a spacious closet and a desk. Breakfast room was really small, but we always managed to get a table. Breakfast variety was ok, nothing special. The best thing about "Kette" is its location!! Just 5 min walk from San Marco Piazza, but still very quiet. I reccommend it to anyone who wants a quiet, beautiful place in Venice canals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwoofers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 night stay in Venice at the Kette Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. We got an Alilaguna boat from the airport to the San Marco stop, which was 12 euros per person and took appoximately 1 hour and 10 minutes. The hotel was a 5 minute walk away from the stop. When we arrived the receptionist and the porter were both extremely helpful and friendly. We were on the 3rd floor and the room was a good size with a nice bathroom. There was a good selection for breakfast although the room was slightly cramped. I particularly liked the coffee!! Top 3 restaurants for dinner: 1) La Caravella - just a short walk away, great service and good seafood. 2) Bacaro Jazz - Near Rialto, a lively place with a good selection of food. 3) Masaniello - located in San Stefano square, great food and excellent service I thoroughly recommend staying at the Kette. I also recommend a day trip to Burano and Torcello. We also saw the 4 seasons by Vivaldi just off San Marco and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poky room with over-firm beds”
Reviews.Author: Stu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night trip to see a concert in the main square. The Kette was superbly located for this, in a quiet setting 2 minutes walk away. I personally wouldn't return there due to the uncomfortably hard beds and lumpy pillows (my son agrees with me on this). The room we had, #222, was tiny. It was clean and nicely decorated though. Breakfast was ok, usual assortment of breads, pastries ham and cheese, and that strange "coffee" that only seems to surface at breakfast time wherever you go. Breakfast area was over-filled with tables, leading to an irritating lack of space. Decent bathroom, helpful staff. Location is the biggest plus for this hotel, although I am sure there are more comfortable establishments in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan01
Reviews.Content: We chose the Kette on our travel agent's recommendation, backed up by the reviews on Trip Advisor. We thought about private water taxi v public vaporreto and as we had 4 pieces of luggage, chose the private taxi (thank goodness). We were quoted 90 euros but we found a Canadian couple to share and got it down to 65 euros - well worth it. The ride into Venice was brilliant and the water taxi dropped us at the back entrance of the hotel. The Kette is a small hotel but very well presented and beautifully furnished. The staff - in particular, the front desk, were excellent - extremely couteous, efficient and very helpful - I would give them a 5 blob rating. The breakfast is as described by other reviewers - perfectly adequate in a smallish dining room but everyone seemed to get a seat and there was plenty to set you up for the day. The location is superb - just a couple of minutes from St Mark's Square. The only problem (for me) is that to get there, my wife and I had to walk past all the major designer shops - Gucci, Prada, Fendi, Valentino, Ferragamo etc; I was able to resist - she wasn't. Why not 5 blobs overall? Only because the room, while very well decorated and finished, was really small and the view from the windows was of a brick wall (Room 141). Did it ruin our enjoyment? Not in the slightest but that's what stopped us rating the Kette with a 5. Venice was absolutely magical and in 4 days, we barely scratched the surface. We will definitely come to Venice again and would certainly choose the Kette again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel........”
Reviews.Author: rbshaw2000
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with a great staff. Great location just off San Marco square. Our room was immaculate and kept that way through our stay. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast buffet was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Sable12.
Reviews.Content: We have no significant complaints about the Kette Hotel. It is superbly located in a quiet backwater within less than ten minutes stroll from St Marks Square and about fifteen minutes from the Rialto Bridge. Its' canalside location enables visitors to arrive directly to the hotel by private transfer from the airport. We were welcomed and shown our room within minutes of stepping off the boat. The hotel appears to be newly decorated and with new carpeting throughout, so it is immaculate. There are two efficient lifts serving the five floors and though the hotel appeared busy, we rarely needed to wait for the lift. Our canal side room was rather small and had only limited storage. There was no chest of drawers, so it was necessary to live out of the suitcase. It was also rather warm for our taste, even though we kept the heating off during our stay. Contrary to some reports, we found the reception desk staff to be very polite, friendly and helpful. The Continental breakfasts were very good and the buffet was continually refreshed. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there is a wide selection in close proximity. We paid an average of 60Euros for dinner for two with a bottle of wine. The Al Falaciani Burreira, (San Marco 353) just off the corner of St Marks Square is friendly and unpretentious, The Tavernetta San Maurizio (San Marco 2619) is small and good but ask for a table with proper chairs. The benches are excrutiatingly uncomfortable! The Trattoria Di Fiore off the corner of Campo Stefano (San Marco 3461) provided the best food we found in Venice. Booking is advisable for all three restaurants in season and the hotel desk will make the arrangements. We thoroughly enjoyed Venice and our stay in the Kette Hotel. We will reccommend the hotel to friends and will use it again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: Petertoria
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in the Hotel Kette for three nites with my girlfriend and enjoyed all of them. The hotel was at first hard to find but with a little luck it only taken 15mins from the time we had landed. On arrival we were greated with a smile and gladly welcomed into the hotel at close to mid-night so that was greatly appricated. The room was nicely laid out but was disappointed to find that the bed was two singles pushed together, this was not what i call romantic and only serves to make it easier for the hotel to change from a (double) to two signles. When tryin to go around the town it is a good location as it only takes 10-15 mins to reach St Marks Square. I would definatly recommend the hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon-7
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend spent 2 nights at the Hotel Kette in January 2007. Even though the Hotel is only about 2 minutes from the st Marks square it isn't the easiest to find. However that would be the only disadvantage i would say about this great hotel. Once you've remembered where the hotel is, you realise just how perfect its location is, 2 minutes from marks square, and seconds from shops and restaurants. The staff were really friendly and always were willing to help. The breakfast was better than what we expected, lots of fruit, bread and cold meats. The room we had was excellent, the beds were comfortable, the ensuite shower room was very nice, and our room overlooked one of the canals. I will recommend this hotel anyone visiting Venice it truely is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paupy
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel and is a great base for exploring Venice, as it's located just a few minutes' walk from St Mark's Square. We found the place from the San Marco water bus stop with no problems, thanks to the excellent hand-drawn map on the hotel's website. Other good points: bedroom was roomy, king size bed was firm but extremely comfy, the continental breakfast was above average and the checkout time of 12pm was appreciated. A few factors stopped me from giving this hotel a higher rating, though. Venice is freezing cold in winter, but the heating had not been turned on inside our room before we arrived at 11pm. We had to fall asleep in our chilly room with the heating on, meaning that we woke up in the early hours in a suffocatingly hot room! The next night was much better, as we heated the room for a couple of hours before bed. We also couldn't get the bathroom heating going on the first night, so this room was very cold until the heater was fixed the following morning. The hand held shower was set up only 10cm above the bathtub on the side, with no shower curtain etc, meaning you either had to sit uncomfortably in the bathtub or spray water all over the room to wash. The bathroom was also in the eaves, which meant that my 5'10" hubby couldn't stand upright in most of the bathroom. And watch out for the bar snacks - we ate half a wrapped cake before we saw a bit had a bit of mould on it, although the hotel can't be blamed for this. Overall the hotel was good, but a few more thoughtful touches would have taken it from good to great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: leeloveridge
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel, would definitely stay there again, rooms were clean and the shower in the bathroom was good. Reception staff were very helpful and polite, a pleasurable stay, the only slight negative i had was that the breakfast was only a continental selection, nothing hot i'm afraid. But all in all good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: ViequesDude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 days in the Hotel Kette in November 2006. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is located just a few "blocks" from Piazza San Marco and the vaporetto stop and is even closer to La Fenice opera house. This location makes it ideal for touring the main sites of Venice and it gives ready access to a large number of restaurants. While it is close to the main tourist sights, it is set one block off a main road, so the location is quiet. Our room was relatively large and elegantly furnished, while the bathroom was large and modern. The staff, dressed in tuxedos, was attentive to our needs, including booking reservations for restaurants and for the Scrovegni Chapel in Padua. An advantage of the hotel over some others is that it has two elevators. No need to climb several flights of stairs after rambling around Venice all day. The list price for this hotel is higher than what we usually pay for hotels, but we booked the hotel and flights to Venice as a package using Expedia. This is the first time I have booked a package (Expedia is very flexible in the way that it lets you choose flights and hotels) and I discovered that it is possible to save a substantial amount of money this way. Our only complaint is that we found the mattresses and pillows to be quite firm. Despite this, we thoroughly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Escape1x
Reviews.Content: Chrissy & Steve: This hotel was clean and well situated. Located 3 mins from S Marco, was ideal and yet, the side street was quiet and overlooked one of the many beautiful canals. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was excellent. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: COMB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Kette for 3 nights from Sept. 24th. The airline had lost our bags and the hotel staff were helpful in helping to trace it. When it was finally delivered, they called us and brought it up to our room. Our room was comfortable (if a little small) ; breakfast was good ; the location is superb. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When we were leaving, we had a water taxi pickup before breakfast started. The receptionist, at the end of his night shift, went into the kitchen and came back with a bag full of breakfast goodies to keep us going. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BarryF
Reviews.Content: Together with friends I stayed at the Hotel Kette for 5 nights from September 20th 2006. We had two double rooms which were well furnished and by Venetian standards of a very satisfactory size. The bathrooms were spotlessly clean and well equipped. Our rooms were to the side of the hotel overlooking a footway and were quiet overnight . The breakfast room offered a good selection of food and the staff were friendly. The reception staff were polite and provided help and information when asked. The hotel is wery well placed being just a short stroll from St Marks Square and is handy for the Vaporettos and the Airport waterbus. I would certainly stay at the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Kette is ideally placed. Comfortable, welcoming and quiet and well run.”
Reviews.Author: barrylewis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 2 minutes from St Marks and within easy walking distance of the main attractions of Venice. Arriving by vaparetto, it is just a few hundred yards, including one set of steps over a canal, from the Valermossa vaparetto stop. Comfortable and quiet, apart from bells at 7am on Sunday morning (which are part of the charm of Venice), the hotel is a good base for sight-seeing. Without its own restaurant there are no cooked breakfasts but it has a range of cereals, meats, cheese, rolls, croisants, toast, yogurts and fruits. The only critisism is that the breakfast room tables are close together, good for sociability, and the room cannot accomodate all guests at one sitting when the hotel is full, so you may have to wait for a table. Staff are helpfull and welcoming and the hotel is well run.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates, fine location”
Reviews.Author: Mike55129
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away into a little side street, a very short walk from all the designer stores--and just yards away from hotels that charge far more for a room. We usually stay in four-star hotels and we were quite satisfied with this one. One warning--no map is going to be able to direct you to this place when you first arrive. If this is your first trip to Venice, you will realize--as we did--that part of the charm of the city is the winding, twisting roads that hold all kinds of interesting discoveries. It took a lot of walking with our luggage--and asking the natives--before we finally discovered the hotel. All the people at the front desk were friendly and spoke English very well. They will ask you to turn in your key each time you leave. One night we took a day trip to Tuscany, and we actually got scolded when we returned to the hotel the next day--the front desk guy said he was very worried since we didn't tell him we were staying overnight somewhere else. Our room was pretty small, like we expect in Europe, but we had a nice view out our window of the canal below. The breakfast was pretty basic, but since it was included in the price, we weren't complaining. We would stay here again. Mary and MIke St. Paul, MN

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanlbinn
Reviews.Content: We loved the Kette! Staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was good and the room is clean and well furnished. The room is small by U.S. standards but had a lovely view of the canal. Bathroom is clean and a good size. We would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nightfalls
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of June. The rooms were small, but clean and the bathroom was a pleasant surprise - roomy, clean, with good lighting, mirrors, and a hairdryer. Our room was a double on the 3rd floor that had a view of a canal below. It was nice to watch the gondolas go by and to pass our windows when we went for our gondola ride. However, our triple room only had a view of the small street below, which was okay, but the canal was better. The location was the best. It was such fun to walk all over Venice and to just be able to pop over to St. Mark's Square was great. The breakfast was fine and the staff, although not very friendly, was helpful when asked. I would certainly stay here again and recommend the Kette Hotel to others. Also, we - 2 adults and 3 teenagers - had several wonderful meals in Venice, but one restaurant I would recommend is Antico Pignolo. The atmosphere was great, the staff was wonderful and the food was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: KimLyndon
Reviews.Content: Not bad for a European hotel but if you're expecting Asian/Pacific standards this is the wrong place for you. Great location a few moments from St Marco's Square and the Grand Canal. Tiny rooms, with highly variable views and when we stayed in the Venetian spring the heating was uncomfortably high. Breakfast was better than in many Italian hotels but nothing to write home about. Price was good for the location. Overall, better than expected. But no-one ever told us about the roof terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel, Miserable Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was disgusting, dark and had the electrical wires hanging out of the walls. The room opened onto the canal which sounds nice, but it was about 10 feet from someones wall and you couldn't see anything but dirt. People partied everynight...all night and construction first thing in the a.m. The staff was miserable, not helpful and never even put a lightbulb in. They had to fix the wires because it was so dangerous. This hotel was so bad that my travel agent upgraded me in every other hotel throughout my trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Kette”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned a six day trip to Venice. This pleasurable experience was made all the more by the staff, the service, and the accommodation at the Hotel Kette. Only two bridges from the P St Marco landing stage it is situated in Piscine St Moise very near the opera house and several enticing restaurants. It is central to all the tourist attractions and has easy access to the vaporetto or a gondola if you prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short break in Venice where we stayed at the Kette Hotel, which is in the San Marco area. It was just faboulous, the staff were very helpful, the room had a double aspect view of the little canal. We could watch the Gondolas float past with the ocasional serenade, which was really romantic. The Hotel is friendly, quirky and in a lovely quiet position, and we thoroughly enjoyed it! We found that eating in the San Marco area was very expensive and usually not very good at all. There are some lovely restaurants along the Grand Canal, which are very reasonable and very good because I guess there is more competition. The best meal we had was at the Metropole Hotel( you may have to book) It was also one of the cheapest! It was pure luxury and the food was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location+Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mch123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Hotel Kette in Venice for 3 nights (25th - 28th March). I would recommend staying in the hotel to anyone, the staff were very friendly and welcoming. Our bedroom was a good size and had a lovely powerful shower. I would recommend NOT to pay more for a superior room as there in work going on near the canal and there is not point paying more. We paid for a standard room adn could see the Canal and Gondolas go past! Breakfast was good, croissants, rolls, cereal, orange juice etc etc. Only problem is that is gets quite full at about 9am, so go there before or after and you'll be fine!! The hotel is in the most fantastic location - just off the smartest street in Venice, with Gucci, Valentino and D&G on your doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Cookie376
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay in Venice. We arrived at the airport and just a short walk to the jetty caught the Ailiaguna Water Bus (10 euros per person each way)to venice. This took 1h 10mins as it stops at most islands. There is another water bus which costs 25 euros per person and takes 25mins. The private water taxis cost 70 euros for 2 people and it the best way to arrive if you can afford it. The san marco stop is directly outside Harrys bar(14 euros per drink). The hotel is a 4min walk from here, over a small bridge at s.moist, take first right street and its there.! Hotel was just like the pictures. Our room was not made up, but immediatley we were given another number 135. The view was on the canal but there are works ongoing in the building opposite so view was extremley restricted. This would apply to all canal view rooms. On arrival our room was cold, on the 2nd night with the help of porter heating was ajusted but with little difference. Breakfast was good everything you need and a good selection of cold meats, rolls, boiled eggs, cheeses and croissants. Coffee and tea served with hot milk pot. Selection of two fruit juices and water. The rialto bridge is a 10mins stroll away and st marcs square 3mins. The hotel had a fab location, was clean and well furnished. It was excellent value for money Â£156 for two nights with easyjet. TIPS 1. Go to the rooftop terrace (we were not informed hotel had one) 2. Ask hotel staff for local information as they do not give it freely. 3. Use vaporetto line number 1 to go up and down grand canal start or end at san marco or piazza roma (you can walk to roma in 25mins stroll) This costs 5 euros each and is valid for travel up to one hour. 4. Gondolas cost 100 euros but with bartering will go down to 80 for 55 mins for 2 people. A night ride with music and singer will cost 300 euros but you get bottle of wine 5 Dont eat at Anapollo restaurant off st marcs sqaure, awful. Tourist menus for 14-19 euros are available but they are only taster meals! 6 Mcdonalds just off st marcs square provides a cheap lunchtime snack for 12 euros. This is the only cheap lunchtime snack in Venice. 7 If using a cafe remember cost doubles if you sit down. 8 Venice is very safe even in the quiet narrow streets. 9 the bar at hotel satunia just from the hotel is great, reasonable and barman very welcoming. 10 Dont be afraid to eat on grand canal near rialto bridge, would expect this to be expensive, but compares favourably with reastarants all over city, with not such a romantic setting 11 Enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jen611
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read some of the recently posted bad reviews of this hotel, because my husband and I have nothing but good things to say! We recently returned from our honeymoon in Italy, and concluded our trip in Venice at the Kette. Our room looked like a hotel room in a palace, very large for a European hotel room, ornately decorated with 2 chandeliers and Roman columns! We even had a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us there (thanks to our travel agent for telling them it was our honeymoon). The location was unbeatableâ€”a 2-minute walk from St. Marcâ€™s Square, right on one of the smaller canals. The staff was pretty helpful (although not the most friendly), and there was internet access in the lobby (for a fee). The breakfast here was a buffet (not American) breakfast, with various cookies and cakes, croissants, yogurt, fresh fruit and cereal. They also served you espresso with steamed milk so you could make your own cappuccinos!I would strongly recommend this hotel for anybody who is interested in visiting Venice because it really had it allâ€”quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Kette is over rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kette hotel was in a great location and adjacent to a small canal, however, those were the only redeeming aspects of the hotel. The rooms were tiny and the bathrooms were awful. Very uncomfortable stay and happy to leave. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my trip which included travel to Venice and stay at Hette hotel, that is 4 stars hotel in great location (5 minutes walking from St. Marco Square) and near voperetto (local waterbus) station and near Airport Waterbus station. The service quality I've got was attentive and efficient and it includes service before arrival (detailed instruction how to get hotel were recieved upon request) and also service during a stay. The room was compact, but efficient with central heating + air conditioner in room. However double bad was actually two single beds shared together, which were too soft. Breakfast was good. In generally I expected less from this hotel. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, though rude staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCLady813
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kette Hotel for two days on my Honeymoon. The Kette Hotel is lovely in a great location. All is near, shopping, St. Mark square.. etc. Very clean. Breakfast area is rather in a small room. Not much selection of food, but good food. I was disappointed though with the front desk. The men at the desk did in my opinion have an attitude when asked general questions. They seemed as if they did not want to be bothered. The Air conditioner in the room worked very well. The Bed was hard. The TV was not working. (I think you might have had to pay extra for the TV.) The bathroom was a nice size. From the room I received, (standard) had small window with no view. I was able to see another building that was very close. My billing was all messed up. I paid my travel agent in advance for the hotel, but kette hotel "forgot" that I already paid. They charged my credit card without my knowledge. The charge on my credit card was a larger amount than what the travel agent had agreed. The Kette hotel did mail me a refund check but the check was less than it was supposed to be. I tried to get in touch with them to resolve the issue, but received no response, no apologies for the error. Beware, give no credit card information to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Kette Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived on October 1, booked for a short stay. "Sorry .... NO ROOM FOR YOU!" After being told a non-believable story about being overbooked, blah-blah-blah, they hustled us down the street to the Saturnia Hotel. If this sounds familiar, there are other (almost) carbon copy stories about this property in your other reviews. Even more amazing was that we stopped at the Kette, a day early, to confirm our reservation. "Absolutely, we are expecting you tomorrow"; then, when we arrive the following day, they shuffle us off. This behavior is unprofessional; the Kette Hotel is unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Could try harder”
Reviews.Author: Phil of England
Reviews.Content: The Kette Hotel is well-located and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The ground-floor public rooms are pleasant enough to lounge around in. The bedrooms are small and somewhat claustrophobic, and laughably short of storage space. The bathrooms are tiny but well-appointed, despite the lack of shower curtains. The air-conditioning in our room was very effective - a must in Venice. If you choose to take the hotel's complimentary (one-way) water-taxi to the glassworks in Murano, then be warned! You will be met off the water-taxi by a pushy salesman who will let you watch the glass-blowing demonstration then take you into a display area and will suddenly turn unpleasant if you choose not to buy anything. Worth a miss. Back in the hotel, breakfast is adequate but unexciting and served in a room that is about half the size it should be to accommodate everybody. I suggest you get in early! All in all, a reasonable hotel - probably not the best in Venice but certainly not the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Venice - Room 501”
Reviews.Author: keem2112
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day 10th Wedding Anniversary trip to Venice. We stayed at the Kette Hotel for four nights and were very pleased with this hotel. Our attic room (501) was medium sized and clean, we did however have the only room with direct sole access to the hotels large roof terrace - excellent roof top views inc St Marks Tower, especially at sunset and sunrise. Both the room and bathroom were well-appointed and the hotel staff were efficient and very polite. The continental breakfast was typical, but above average - only downside was that the breakfast room was relatively small and was awkward when busy. My wife (but not me nor my bank manager) was also pleased with the extensive designer shopping on offer nearby! The location of the Kette is ideal: central, and easy to find (well some days it was! - if you didn`t get lost in the maze of streets). I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Kette Hotel was in an excellent location. Service was very good, staff was extremely friendly. The breakfast was similar to those that we had in other hotels in Italy (cold cuts, bread, pastries, juice & coffee, etc.) Room was very nice with a view of the side streets. Bed was lumpy and hard though. The hotel provides a compimentary trip to Murano to visit the glass making process first hand (you will, though, have to secure your own ride back to the hotel). The only negative of the hotel was that the front desk recommended a Gondola ride that was very misleading. We purchased the ticket at the hotel b/c we had asked around & the lowest price was $80 for 30 minutes (by ourselves). So when the hotel said that although we would share the gondola w/3 other people, for $70 we would have music & a serenade on a 45 min ride. What we were NOT aware of was that there would also be 8 other gondolas listening to the singer. The actual serenade took place on the first gondola and we where in the last one - making it almost impossible to hear him sing. To top it off, the gondola workers were arguing and talking loudly to each other - very annoying (takes away from the whole "romantic" thing). We mentioned our disappointed w/the hotel but the only reaction was an act of surprise & note-taking, no apology or recompense.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Piazza San Marco and some fun shops. Our room overlooked a small, quiet canal - charming. The staff and service were very good. The room was surprisingly large considering the closet-sized spaces we'd been given in Florence and, especially, Rome (and that was an upgrade!). The room also had some lovely pieces of Venetian glass, as it should. The bartender was a friendly young guy who couldn't ask enough questions about the US. A nice hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lacking in facilities and maintenance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here but found the general maintenance of the building very poor. When we arrived at our room (in the attic) we found the toilet seat half off and fixed it ourselves as no maintenance person was around to fix it. The bathroom curiously had an emergency pull cord in the bath space which went off although no one touched the cord. I guess at least it worked as we had a phone call from reception saying that it had 'gone off' although we were trying to get to sleep! Breakfast was very continental German in type of food and presentation. Very un-inspiring for a start to the day, so most days I didn't bother. The coffee was thick and overbrewed. Prior to staying here I had stayed at other hotels in Italy during this 2 week touring holiday and quite frankly some of the 2 star rated ones were better. A friend of ours stayed in a lower grade hotel (there was no more room at the inn) and had far superior accommodation including a plasma screen with 40 odd channels including BBC world compared with our Italian only 4 tuned channels CRT TV which belongs in a science museum. Room was fitted out with basic furniture and no-where near enough storage space for two people, so we had to keep most of our clothes in the suitcases. That being, we travelled very lightly with only one small suitcase and one piece of hand-luggage each! The hotel bar was about as basic as one could possible get, no hot chocolate, a stock of 2 bottles of Italian beer, dreadful coffee and tea etc. very very poor. On the other hand the reception rooms on the ground floor were comfortable and well furnished. The staff were generally polite and did efficiently order us a water taxi back to the airport when we left as we had an early flight. Rooms ought to be checked for full functionality at every change-over. One really shouldn't have to fix the bedside light before getting into bed. View from room, what view?!? Air conditioning is almost non-existant which left the room far too hot at all times and no way were we going to have the windows open because of mosquito's etc. The cleaning staff did manage to leave the windows open and we spent a good hour when we got back at night tracking down all the mosquito's! Great fun eh? My previous 6 visits to Venice were at much better hotels and cheaper. I will not be going back to the Kette Hotel again. This hotel was booked through Trailfinders in the UK and I'll be sending them a copy of this report.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lunamel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night stay at Hotel Kette and thought the hotel was fabulous. We had a lovely room overlooking the canal, which runs down one side of the hotel building. Both the room and the bathroom were a good size (though I understand that the room sizes do vary a little). The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly in relation to helping us make dinner reservations in Venice. I would definitely stay there again. One point: some people have suggested that the electrical sockets in the rooms can't be used. I don't know what they're talking about: our room had european sockets, as you'd expect to find in Italy, and we could use them very easily with a travel adaptor.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TzviaO
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day trip to Venice during the Carnaval. We stayed at the Kette for four nights and were very pleased with the hotel. Our room overlooked a small canal, the furniture is classical Venetian style and very romantic. Though the room was small, it was cosy and spotlessly clean. The bathroom is well-appointed , with green marble floor and towel-warmer. The staff was efficient and very polite. We ended our stay asking them to order for us a water-taxi which arrived in minutes and fetched us from the back door of the hotel directly to the airport. The location of Kette is ideal : central, easy to find yet quiet. Nothing could be better for Venice. During the long days of the Carnaval we could come back for a short rest at the hotel and then return to Piazza San Marco in a few minutes. I highly recommend this hotel! Very good reward for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_crafty_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Kette. We found the hotel easily from the San Marco Waterbus stop. Our room was ready when we arrived so we checked in straightaway which was great. Our room was quite small and looked inwards to nothing much, but it was bright and spotlessly clean, good clean carpets and very comfortable beds. Air-con was very effective at heating the room as it was rather cold in Venice (Feb 1-3). The beds had a lovely wall canopy over them and there was a lovely Murano glass chandelier to light the room â€“ all very regal! The room was very quiet although the marble corridors did mean you hear the very occasional tap of feet as people go to their rooms but this was not a problem. The bathroom was the tiniest Iâ€™ve ever seen but fully functional and spotlessly clean and heavenly WARM thanks to the heated towel rail! Apart from shavers, for which there was a specific plug, the plugs in the room would not accommodate our 2 pin plugs â€“ someone else said in an earlier review that they were not â€œallowedâ€� to charge things up so maybe thatâ€™s why these hybrid 2/3 pin sockets have been fitted? But please donâ€™t let this put you off staying at this lovely hotel. Staff were friendly and very polite and there was a good cold breakfast buffet and nice public rooms. The Hotel was very convenient - just 2 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco, and 2 seconds from La Fenice Theatre. We got an excellent price considering it was Carnival and we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PatCrit
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. My son and I spent three nights here and were impressed with the large, clean room, extremely courteous staff, and assistance in all we required. I booked directly through the Net to their website, and was given a prompt reply with many helpful hints on this my first visit to Venice. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: Marvelmann
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel! Super staff, amazing location and beautifully appointed rooms. Would definitely go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Kette Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 2053 | Piscina San Moise, 30124 Venice, Italy
